loans.name: Marina Isabel

texts.es:
La Señora Marina Isabel trabaja para una escuela pública en el municipio de la paz centro desde hace 10 años como profesora de primaria con lo que ha sacado adelante su familia que esta conforma por su esposo y dos hijos, brindándole estudio, alimentación y demás necesidades básicas del hogar.

Actualmente es su segundo crédito que solicita a ceprodel el anterior lo pago bien, espera se le otorgue este  ya que  lo requiere para mejorar su vivienda en la ampliación de la cocina y comenzar a construir un cuarto con lo que pretende realizar cambio de techo, con sus esfuerzos espera reembolsar este crédito, dándole una mejor condición de vida a su familia
texts.en: Marina Isabel has worked as an elementary school teacher at a public school in La Paz Centro for ten years.  She’s supported her family consisting of her husband and two children this way providing schooling, food and other basic household needs.  This is her second Ceprodel loan request.  She repaid the previous one well and hopes this one will be granted too since she needs it to make home improvements.  She will enlarge the kitchen and start building a room and also replace the roof.  She expects to repay the loan with her efforts while providing her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to build a kitchen and to replace the roof.

loans.name: Arnoldo Jose

texts.es:
El Señor Arnoldo José trabaja para un centro público en el municipio de la paz centro desde hace 7 años como conductor de ambulancia con lo que ha sacado adelante su familia que esta conforma  por su compañera de vida y tres hijos, brindándole estudio, alimentación y demás necesidades básicas del hogar.

Actualmente es su primer crédito que solicita a ceprodel lo requiere para mejora de vivienda con lo que pretende realizar cambio de techo y ampliación de dormitorios, dándole una mejor condición de vida a su familia
texts.en: Arnoldo José has worked as an ambulance driver for a public center in La Paz Centro for seven years.  He’s supported his family consisting of his wife and three children this way providing for schooling, food and other basic household needs.  This is his first Ceprodel loan request.  He needs it to replace the roof and enlarge bedrooms providing better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 41 years old and married with five children.  She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. 

Judith is borrowing PHP 29000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Judith has been raising pigs for two years, and also earns additional income from ready-to-wear clothing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Fazil

texts.en:
Fazil is 45 years old, married, and has nine children.  He lives in Kasese, Uganda. He is a very hardworking man who is determined to change his future and that of his children through a number of businesses.

Fazil has been growing banana and sugar cane for 15 years.  With the income earned from farming, he has been able to build rental houses and buy a car for his transport business.  He also earns a salary as civil servant.

Fazil is requesting a loan, which he will use to buy fertilizers and manure for his banana and sugar cane plantation. Like all good fathers, he wishes to see his children graduate with degrees while his business dream is to be one of the leading sugar cane growers in the country.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and manure.

loans.name: Modesto

texts.en:
Modesto is a farmer, who has untiringly worked hard in the hectare plot of land he manages. He has been planting and harvesting rice crops to sell for over 15 years now. He is married to a housekeeper, who is his partner in the business. They have had four children. Three are in their college education and taking degrees.   He was inspired by his children's determination in school.

Modesto has to improve crop production for higher yields, and that is why he is now asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy five bags of urea (fertilizers) and five liters of insecticides for use in the farming business. Additional revenue generated will be invested for education. 

He hopes to keep growing as a succesful farmer, and will be happy and proud to see all his children professionals in their chosen carreers someday.

loans.use: to buy five bags of urea (fertilizers) and five liters of insecticides for use in the farming business.

loans.name: Kenia Andrea

texts.es: Kenia es una joven Maestra de Educación Primaria comprometida con el desarrollo académico, imparte clases en un colegio de larreynaga, con mucho amor ella se traslada a su centro de labores a una distancia de aproximadamente 15 km, lo realiza diario, es soltera vive con su mama, con la que convine el apoyo mutuo madre e hija, esta joven manifestó tener una necesidad de mejorar la vivienda, anhelando  tener la oportunidad de  financiamiento para sufragar la necesidad antes planteada,  con ese objetivo se presento a las oficinas de ceprodel para formalizar dicho crédito, lo que llena de satisfacción personal al ser beneficiada, por que lograra el sueño esperado, de esta obra dependerá mejorar las condiciones y nivel de vida en el hogar.
texts.en: Kenia is a young elementary school teacher committed to academic development.  She teaches classes in a school in Larreynaga.  She lovingly heads to her workplace which is about 15 kilometers away.  She does so daily.  She’s single living with her mother where they provide mutual mother-daughter support.  This young woman stated that she needed to improve her home and needs a loan to do so.  With that end in mind she came by Ceprodel’s offices to formalize the loan the granting of which gives her much personal satisfaction because she’ll reach her dream.  The improvement of her living conditions and standard of living at home depends on this construction project.

loans.use: to buy building supplies and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Vecinal 3 Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “VECINAL 3”  iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Juana es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de chompas y polainas, tejido de mantas de vicuña, venta de pan, venta de carne, costura de faldas, tejido de ajuares de bebe, tejido de guantes.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Juana es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de confección de mantas de vicuña; cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió hace años aprendiendo de su madrina quien la alentó a la venta de este producto.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana de vicuña) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en unión libre.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.

En la fotografía no estan presentes las señoras María y Gabriela, ya que fueron a realizarse la consulta médica.
texts.en:
The “Vecinal 3” communal bank will start its second cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana Focal Center.  It has ten members led by a governing board presided by Juana.  The members carry out a variety of businesses among which are knitting sweaters and leggings, weaving vicuña wool blankets, selling bread, selling meat, sewing skirts, knitting baby outfits and knitting gloves.

The loan they’ll take out will benefit small micro businesswomen.  Juana is one of them.  She indicates that she’s been a member of Pro Mujer for a year having joined invited by a girlfriend who is a member of the institution.  She currently has a business weaving vicuña blankets.  She relates that she started the business years ago having learned from her godmother who encouraged her to sell this product.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase capital.  She will buy vicuña wool in street markets in El Alto and after making them will sell the blankets in her stand.  This way of working allows her to generate resources necessary to support her family the best way possible since she’s in a common law relationship.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health training and the credit.

María and Gabriela do not appear in the photo because they were at medical appointments.

loans.use: to buy vicuña wool.

loans.name: Ginia Maria

texts.es:
La educación es la base principal para el desarrollo de un país y es por este motivo que hoy en día se requieren maestros muy capaces y con altos conocimientos en la materia. Consciente de esto,  la señora Ginia se dedica a laborar como maestra en una comunidad del  municipio de Larreynaga atendiendo niños de varias edades y cuya preocupación principal es la educación en estas personas ya que son el futuro de la nación.
Ginia solicita a ceprodel   un crédito para la compra de cómo perfumes de mujer, de hombre, cremas , shampoo, talco para pie, brillo labial, lápiz de ceja y crema anew;  Cabe señalar que Ceprodel se ha caracterizado por apoyar a estos maestros que sin duda contribuyen al desarrollo de los pequeños, y por ende al desarrollo de la familia, en su caso, mejora las condiciones y nivel de vida efectuando las mejoras en su Negocio, y de esa manera crear mejores condiciones en su familia, con este crédito espera que su negocio crezca, tendrá la oportunidad de lograr subsanar la necesidad prioritaria de su negocio.
texts.en:
Education is the main foundation of a country’s development which is why skilled, highly trained teachers are required nowadays.  Conscious of this, Gina works as a teacher in a community in Larreynaga teaching children of various ages.  Her main concern is their education since they are the nation’s future.  

Gina asks Ceprodel for a loan to buy women’s and men’s perfume, creams, shampoo, foot powder, lip gloss, eye brow pencils and Anew cream.  It’s worth noting that Ceprodel has been characterized by lending to teachers who without a doubt contribute to the development of children and thus to the family.  In her case, she will make home improvements and improve her standard of living by improving her business thus creating better conditions for her family.  She hopes the loan will help her business to grow for she will have the means of meeting her main business need.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 44 years old and married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Lilibeth has a furniture making business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 29000 loan amount through NWTF to buy raw materials for her furniture making.  Lilibeth has been in this business for 20 years.
 
In the future, Lilibeth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her furniture making business.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 63 years old and married with seven children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Lilia is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and medicine for her pigs.

Lilia has been raising pigs for six years and also earns additional income from basket weaving.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicine for her pigs.

loans.name: Galina

texts.ru: Галина торгует постельным бельем, подушками, одеялами, полотенцами. Занимается она этим бизнесом уже более 10 лет и знает про свой товар все, что можно знать – где и по чем купить качественный товар, а также кому и по чем продать. Недавно Галина открыла вторую торговую точку. Взяла туда продавца, но продавец оказался нечестный и обокрал Галину. Теперь ей нужно заполнить точку товаром, чтобы у покупателей был выбор. Галина просит предоставить ей кредит для расширения ассортимента.  Надеется, что с помощью кредита она сможет увеличить свой торговый оборот и в результате прибыль.
texts.en:
Galina makes a living by selling bed sheets, pillows, blankets, towels and so forth. She's run this business for the last ten years and knows everything there is to know about her product: where to buy quality goods for cheap, where to and who to sell to. She recently opened a second sales point, but hired an unfit employee to run it, who robbed her. Now she needs to restock her shop so that consumers will buy her goods. 

Galina is asking for a loan in order to expand her product range and assortment. She hopes that the loan will allow her to increase her sales volume and profits.

loans.use: to expand her product range.

loans.name: Francinia

texts.es: Francinia tiene 30  años de edad, esta casada y vive con el esposo y dos hijos actualmente. Ella con el crédito pretende dar seguimiento a su proyecto de apicultura. Ella quiere tratar de mejorar la calidad de su miel, para así distribuirla y contribuir con su familia, esta humilde mujer y de buena familia no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para continuar dándole asistencia a dicho proyecto, ya que es de bajos recursos y no tiene como adquirir el dinero necesario para esto, por lo que ella solicito un crédito, y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Francinia is thirty years old, married, and lives with her husband and their two sons. With this loan, she wants to improve her apicultural business, in particular the quality of the honey she produces, in order to sell this product and help with the household expenses. This humble woman of good moral standards lacks the necessary financial resources to keep on with her project, since her income is very low and she does not have the means to pursue her goal. This is why she turns to field partner FUDECOSUR for her first ever loan. She never tried to take out a loan in a government bank but chose FUDECOSUR directly because they provide loans more easily and with much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to improve her apicultural business.

loans.name: Nelly Yolanda

texts.es:
Nelly tiene 56 años de edad, está casada, vive en el municipio de Tela, Atlántida junto a su esposo y una hija.
Doña Nelly lleva 4 años de dedicarse a su propio negocio de venta de ropa. Vende de manera ambulante y en su casa. Ofrece ropa nueva y usada para damas caballeros y niños, sabanas, y cortinas. El negocio es rentable ha manejado muy bien dos préstamos anteriores y ahora solicita un tercero por la cantidad de 10,000 lempiras que lo utilizara para comprar un fardo de ropa usada surtida de camisas, jeans, camisetas, blusas, vestidos y ropa de niño. Este préstamo le va ayudar a incrementar su inventario y sus ingresos. Ella tiene como meta tener su negocio siempre surtido que le genere ingresos para mejorar su casa y tener mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Nelly, 56, is married and lives in Tela, Atlántida with her husband and daughter.  Nelly’s been working in her own clothing sales business for four years.  She sells from place to place and from home.  She sells new and used clothes for women, men and children and sheets and curtains.  The business is profitable and she’s managed her two previous loans well.  She’s now requesting her third for 10,000 Lempiras that she’ll use to buy a bale of assorted used jeans, shirts, t-shirts, blouses, dresses and children’s clothes.  This loan will help her increase her inventory and her income.  Her goal is to always have her business well-stocked so that it will generate income to make home improvements and have better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a bale of assorted used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ermelinda

texts.es: Ermelinda tiene 40 años de edad, casada, tiene dos hijos y vive en una aldea del municipio de Tela, Atlántida. Hace dos años que estableció su propio negocio en su casa donde vende productos de consumo diario como ser, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, sal, pan, manteca, productos enlatados, pastillas, verduras, harina, condimentos, carnes, lácteos y otros. En su barrio ya tiene su clientela establecida. esta solicitando el tercer préstamo a ODEF, el cual es de 10,000 Lempiras, con el fin de surtir mas su pulpería de productos comestibles como carnes, lácteos, arroz, frijoles, harina, verduras, azúcar, condimentos y manteca. Con esta inversión va incrementar sus ventas y sus ingresos. Tiene como meta hacer crecer el negocio y apoyar a sus hijos con la educación.
texts.en: Ermelinda, 40, is married and has two children.  She lives in a village in Tela, Atlántida.  She started her own home-based grocery store two years ago.  She sells basic staples that are consumed daily like rice, beans, sugar, salt, bread, lard, canned gods, pills, vegetables, flour, condiments, meats, dairy products and others.  She already has a well-established clientele in her neighborhood.  She’s asking for her third ODEF loan for 10,000 Lempiras to stock her store with food items like meats, dairy products, rice, beans, flour, vegetables, sugar, condiments and lard.  She will increase sales and income with this investment.  Her goal is to make the business grow and to support her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Panha

texts.en: Panha is 27 years old. She is married and resides with one child in Kandal Province, Cambodia. She has been running a general store for more than a year, earning approximately $5 daily. Her husband is a mechanic who earns about $8 daily. In order to improve her family’s finances, Panha is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase groceries to sell. This purchase will help her generate more income for her family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and send her child to a good school. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her house to make it more comfortable for the family.

loans.use: to purchase groceries for sale.

loans.name: Arpeña

texts.en: Arpeña is from Malaubang, Ozamiz City. She is 58 years old and married with six children. To make a living, Arpeña has managed a retail store for seven years and gained 5,000 PHP monthly. Arpeña joined GDMPC in 2011 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arpeña is requesting a loan of 5,500 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar, and coffee. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar, and coffee

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a resident of Mombasa area of Coast province, Kenya. He is married and has one child. He owns a charcoal business which has been in operation for the last six months.
 
Ali learned about Milango through a friend, and joined the organization with an aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of his business. His main challenge is the punitive measures at this time enforced upon charcoal sellers, by the local administration. Ali is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenyan shillings to purchase an additional stock of charcoal. He will use the extra income from the loan to add to his savings, to improve the living standard of his family and to pay for his child’s future school fee requirements. He aspires to be a wholesaler of charcoal.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en: For six years in Malaubang, Ozamis City, Mildred, a 38-year-old married mom of six children, has made a living buying and selling vegetables. She earns 4,500 a month for these activities. In 2009, Mildred joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy more vegetables to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en:
Winfred lives in the Kongowea area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is a married mother of one child and owns a green grocery stall which she has been operating for two years. In this business, Winfred sells greens, fruits, and vegetables. She also runs a retail shop.

Winfred learned about Milango through a friend; she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. The challenges she is facing are bad debts and lack of capital to expand the business, an issue she feels will be partly solved by the loan for which she is applying.

Winfred is applying for a loan of 15,850 KES to buy wholesale vegetables and retail stock like soap and sugar. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to expand the business. Her plans for the future are to start other businesses and also open stalls in different areas.

loans.use: to buy wholesale vegetables and retail stock for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soda and beer to resell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is married with 3 children. She is 48 years old, residing in the Philippines. 

Elizabeth raises pigs for sale to earn a living. She's been in this business for 10 years. Each month she earns 7,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase feeding supplies. She been a member of GDMPC since 2010. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and to finish her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase feeding supplies

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is 43 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Vicenta is borrowing 29,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and medicine for her pigs.

Vicenta has been raising pigs for 13 years and also earns additional income from selling scrap materials.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicine for her pigs.

loans.name: Ainur

texts.ru: Айнура 39 лет, замужем и воспитывает троих детей. Супруг Айнуры работает строителем. В поисках источника финансирования для своей семьи, Айнура начала свой бизнес в животноводстве еще 1991 году, использовав для этого стартовую сумму 5,000 сом (KGS). Успешно работая в сфере животноводства и полеводства добилась очень хороших результатов, Айнура также выращивает кормовые культуры, что позволяет ей обеспечивать кормами свой скот и иметь дополнительный доход от продажи кормов.Помимо кормовых на своём участке Айнура выращивает картофель. Дополнительный доход Айнура имеет с заработной платы, работая в школе поваром. Ежемесячно семья имеет до 25,000 KGS.  Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Айнура обратилась в компанию «Бай - Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 135,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров с телятами и несколько голов МРС. На прибыль от кредита Айнура планирует увеличить своё хозяйство. Айнура поделилась, что в будущем она планирует выдать замуж дочку и улучшить условия содержания скота, построить новый большой сарай.
texts.en:
Ainur is 39 years old, married and has three children. Her husband works as a construction worker. Looking for an additional source of income for her family, she began an animal raising business in 1991 from a starting capital of 5,000 soms (KGS). She successfully ran her business and was able to start growing various grain crops that she sells for profit and uses as fodder for her cattle. She also grows potatoes. Ainur also earns money by working as a cook in a local school. Thus, her family has a monthly budget of up to 25,000 soms (KGS). 

In order to expand her business further, Ainur approached "Bai Tushum and Partners" with a request for a loan of 135,000 soms (KGS) in order to purchase some cows with calves and several heads of small-horned cattle. She wants to increase her business using profits from the loan. In the future, she plans to marry off her daughter and to improve the living conditions of her cattle by building a new barn.

loans.use: To purchase cows and sheep.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally has a four-year-old child. Her husband is working abroad as a driver for a company in Saudi Arabia, so she is the primary caregiver for their child. Sally admits that being the head of the family and providing for their needs is difficult. She and her child always miss her husband, but she says they learn to adjust because she believes that her husband is working abroad for their future.

Sally manages a sari-sari, or general store, business selling canned goods, soft drinks, spices, and biscuits. She wants to expand the products she sells to her costumers, but she doesn’t have enough capital. Thus, Sally is asking for a loan of 50,000 PHP to buy beverages, eggs, breads, soaps, and shampoo. She hopes the loan will help raise her income, allowing her to help her husband sustain their household expenses.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for sale in her general store.

loans.name: Kanayim

texts.ru: Канаиым 52 года. Образование у Канаиым средне-специальное, медицинское. В течении 17 лет Канаиым работала в местной больнице медсестрой. Канаиым награждена национальной премией матери героини, у нее 6 детей. Один сын проживает вместе с ней. Остальные обустроены и имеют свои собственные семьи. По хозяйству Канаиым помогают внуки и сын. По характеру она очень приятная и отзывчивая женщина. После развала СССР семья начала занимается сельским хозяйством. Сейчас семья выращивает скот и занимается полеводством. Совокупный годовой доход семьи составляет около 150,000 KGS Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Канаиым обратилась в компанию «Бай - Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков и на строительство загона для скота. На прибыль от кредита планирует дать образование внукам.
texts.en:
Kanayim is 52 years old. She has had vocational training specializing in medicine and she worked as a nurse for 17 years. Kanayim was awarded the "National Mother-Heroine Award"; she has six children. One of her sons lives with her. Her son and grandsons assist her in running the business. 

Kanayim has a very nice and sympathetic personality. After the fall of the USSR, she started running a farm. Today, they grow raise cattle and grow crops. Their annual revenue is around 150,000 soms (KGS). 

In order to expand her business, Kanayim approached "Bai Tushum and Partners" with a request for a loan of 70,000 soms (KGS) in order to build a corral for her cattle and to buy some bulls. She wants to use profits from the loan to provide a good education for her grandsons.

loans.use: To build a a corral for her cattle and to buy some bulls.

loans.name: Jose Estevan

texts.es:
El señor Estevan es una persona ejemplar por muchos años se dedico al magisterio como vocación impartiendo el pan de la enseñanza, actualmente es el delegado municipal del ministerio de educación de un poblado de león, es soltero vive con su mama una señora de edad avanzada, al que tiene el cuidado de su salud.

Una de las necesidades que presenta el señor Estevan  es de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda debido a que ha estado en mal estado y en época de invierno se nota más la necesidad antes planteada, es por eso que tomo la decisión de iniciar la obra de mejora, por tal razón solicita a  Ceprodel un crédito  para la compra de materiales de construcción como zinc, perlin, tubos, cemento, arena, varilla de soldar y mano de obra. 

Para iniciar la  mejora de la vivienda en la reparación del techo y Pared  para mejor seguridad de la vivienda, por medio de esta obra brindara mejores condiciones a su familia.
texts.en:
Estevan is an exemplary person who has dedicated many years to the teaching profession; and he is currently the municipal delegate of the Ministry of Education for the village of León.  He is single and lives with and cares for his elderly mother.

One of Estevan's needs is to improve the living conditions of his home since it is in disrepair, and in the winter the need becomes even more apparent.  So he has decided to begin construction work and is requesting a loan through Ceprodel to buy construction materials such as corrugated metal, beams, pipes, cement, sand, welding rod and hire workers.

He plans to start renovation by repairing the roof and walls for more safety in the home.  This project will give his family better living conditions.

loans.use: To buy corrugated metal, beams, pipes, cement, sand, welding rods and hire workers.

loans.name: Alba Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Alba originaria de una comarca del municipio de león, se dedica arduamente desde la época de sus padres a cultivar la tierra en conjunto con su marido, lo que le han permitido ser buenos productores con buenos rendimientos, apoyado con los financiamientos oportunos que ceprodel le ha brindado siendo buenos pagadores y observándoles mejores condiciones familiares, también ejercen la actividad pecuaria como otra alternativa económica familiar.
Es casada con 4 personas a su cargo,  entre ellos esta la que se promocionara de educación secundaria por el cual está solicitando crédito a ceprodel para utilizarlo en los gastos mismos y en la compra de fertilizante Urea 46% para efectuar la ultima aplicación en el cultivo de sorgo,  con ese objetivo solicita a ceprodel un crédito por falta de recurso disponible para realizar sus actividades, de esa manera espera mejorar las condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Alba is from a county in the municipality of León.  She has been a hard-working farmer ever since her parents' days, and she and her husband cultivate the land together.  This has allowed them to become good producers with abundant harvests.  The have received financial support when necessary through Ceprodel and have a good credit record and acknowledged improvement of their family living conditions.  They also are active in livestock farming for extra income.

Alba is married and has four people in her care, one of whom is a secondary education student.  Part of the loan through Ceprodel will be used to cover education expenses.  The other part will be used to buy 46% urea fertilizer for the sorghum crop.  The loan from Ceprodel is needed due to a lack of resources for these purposes, and in the hope of improving lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy 46% urea fertilizer and to pay for education expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy yarn for making blouses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: clean his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Karimahan

texts.ru:
Каримахан 51 год мать двоих детей, замужем. Муж Каримахан работает в Росии водителем.По образованию Каримахан швея технолог, в течении долгих лет она работала  швейном цеху по пошиву мужских брюк. На данный момент она занимается пошивом женской и мужской одежды на заказ, по мимо этого она занимается реставрацией кожаной одежды.
Благодаря трудолюбию и общительности Каримахан, за время работы она наработала много постоянных клиентов. Ведь Она шьет очень качественные и красивые вещи.Кроме одной наемное работницы Каримахан, в ведении бизнеса помогает её дочь.Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Каримахан обратилась в компанию «Бай - Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 швейных машин. На прибыль от кредита она хочет расширить бизнес и  начать шить детские ползунки, крупными партиями. В дальнейшем она планирует построить дом своему сына и благоустроить свой дом.
texts.en:
Karimahan is 51 years old, is the mother of two children and is married.  Karimahan's husband works as a driver in Russia.  Karimahan is a seamstress/technologist by education; for many years she worked at a sewing factory sewing men's pants.  At this moment she sews women's and men's clothing to order, in addition she restores leather clothing.

Thanks to Karimahan's diligence and sociabillity, she has acquired a lot of regular clients while working.  She sews very high quality and beautiful clothing.  In addition to one employee. Karimahan's daughter helps in the business.  To further expand her business Karimahan has turned to Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to purchase 2 sewing machines.  She would like to use the income from the loan to expand her business and to start sewing baby onesies in large batches.  In the future she plans to build a house for her son and to improve her home.

loans.use: to purchase 2 sewing machines

loans.name: Santos Gilberto

texts.es: Santos vive en el cantón La Libertad de la provincia de Santa Elena. Es casado y el mayor de sus hijos tiene 16 años el segundo 14 años el tercero de 8 años y el ultimo tiene 2 años. Su padre fue el que le enseño el oficio de lo que es la fabricacion de muebles .En la actualidad trabaja en la fabricación de muebles de lunes a viernes desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde. Con el crédito comprara pintura, madera, soplete,herramientas etc. Su meta es poder ampliar su negocio para poder contratar más empleados para que la producción de muebles mejore y así poderle s dar un futuro a sus hijos
texts.en:
Santos lives in the district of La Libertad, in the province of Santa Elena and is married. The oldest of his children is 16 years old, the second is 14, the third is 8, and the youngest is 2. His father taught him the trade of furniture making. Now he makes furniture from Monday to Friday, from 9 in the morning to 5 in the afternoon. 

With the loan he will buy paint, wood, a blowtorch, tools, etc. He aims to be able to expand his business, to hire more employees so that the furniture production improves and so that he can give his children a future.

loans.use: to buy paint, wood, a blowtorch, tools etc.

loans.name: Daylin  Eliett

texts.es:
La señora Daylin  es una mujer ejemplar en su comunidad, ya que es maestra de Educación primaria en un colegio  de del sector donde habita, es Madre soltera  con 2 hijos a su cargo, es apoyada por su Mama en el cuido de sus hijos ya que conviven en la misma casa.

Esta señora tiene una necesidad urgente como es la construcción de Pared de su vivienda las que están en mal estado, y solo atravez de la oportunidad crediticia que le brinda ceprodel, lo puede lograr, ya que su salario es bajo y no le prestaría las condiciones para realizar su sueño de tener una vivienda Digna, por lo que decidió acudir a ceprodel para solicitar un financiamiento y ser beneficiada para realizar las mejoras y lograr cubrir la necesidad, agradeciéndole por el apoyo oportuno y por beneficiar a los de escasos recursos  que sabemos agradecer los gestos de apoyo.
texts.en:
Daylin is an exemplary woman in her community, since she is an elementary school teacher in the town where she lives.  She is a single mother of two children cares for them with the help of her mother since they all live together in the same house.

This lady has an urgent need to repair the walls in her house because they are in bad shape, and the only way she can do this is through a loan from Ceprodel.  She has a low salary and is not in a situation to carry out her dream of having a decent home.  Therefore, she decided to request the loan so she could make the home improvements.  She is grateful for this support and the loans benefitting people with low incomes.

loans.use: To buy pumice stone, cement, sand, etc. and hire workers.

loans.name: Elizabet

texts.es:
La señora Elizabet es Maestra de Educación Secundaria, actualmente imparte clases en un centro educativo de una comunidad de larreynaga,  es Casada.

Al darse cuenta que ceprodel está beneficiando los sectores más pobres, visito las oficinas para solicitar un financiamiento y poder realizar las mejoras a su vivienda la que no ha podido efectuarlo porque su salario no cubre para  hacer  dichas obras,  solamente con la oportunidad  que brinda ceprodel se puede lograr cumplir los sueños deseados haciendo realidad, de esa manera mejorar las condiciones y nivel de vida,
texts.en:
Elizabet is a secondary school teacher and works at a school in the community of Larreynaga.  She is married.

When she learned that Ceprodel was helping the most poverty stricken areas, she decided to visit their offices and request a loan for home improvement.  She does not earn enough salary to pay for the work and is only able to do so thanks to help from Ceprodel.  This will allow her to turn her dreams into reality, improve her living conditions and lead a better lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy ceramic tile and cement, and hire workers.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a white cheese production business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her white cheese production business.

NWTF is relisting Yolanda's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for making white cheese.

loans.name: Elenora

texts.ru: Эленора 38 лет,замужем, мать двоих детей.В развитии и содержании хозяйства большую помощь оказывает муж Эленоры, который имеет огромный опыт в ведении агробизнеса. После развала союза Эленора получила свою долю колхозной земли. Эленора в качестве основного дохода начала заниматься животноводством и растениеводством, стартовав этот бизнес с суммы 5,000 сом около 20 лет назад.По характеру Эленора очень интересный, доброжелательный и ответственный человек. Благодаря упорному труду Эленоры, ее хозяйство в очень хорошем состоянии.На момент осмотра в хозяйстве имеется 6 дойных коров и 10 голов баранов.Ежедневно Эленора сдает молоко.Ежемесячная прибыль хозяйства составляет 8,000 KGS сом В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Эленора обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 3 бычков для откорма и дальнейшей продажи на местном рынке. Доходы от кредита Эленора планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, чтобы накопить средства на улучшение жилищных условий то есть сделать ремонт. В дальнейшем она мечтает купить квартиру в городе Каракол.
texts.en:
Elenora is 38 years old, married and has two children. She's a very interesting, good willing and responsible person. After the fall of the Soviet Union, Elenora received some land and build a farm, which become her main source of income. Elenora's husband has a lot of experience in running farms and helps out in maintaining and developing their business.

Thanks to her hard work and determination, her farm is in very good condition. She began her business 20 years ago with a starting capital of 5,000 soms; today, she owns 6 cows and 10 bulls. She's able to sell milk on a daily basis. Her monthly income is around 8,000 soms (KGS). 

In order to expand her business even further, Elenora approached "Bai Tushum and Partners" with a request for a loan of 70,000 soms (KGS) in order to purchase 3 bulls for fattening and resale. Elenora plans to invest the profits from the loan into her business and increase her herd head count, then repair her home and improve her living conditions. In the future, she dreams of buying an apartment in the city of Karakol.

loans.use: To purchase 3 bulls.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en: Roselyn is from Malaubang, Ozamiz City. She is 30 years old, married, and has 3 children. Roselyn buys and sells snack foods for a living and has been in business for 8 years. She earns 7,000 PHP a month from this activity. In 2008, Roselyn joined GDMPC. Roselyn is requesting a loan of 11,500 PHP which will be used to purchase additional snack food items like puto (rice cakes) to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and to cover daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase additional snack food items like puto (rice cakes) to sell.

loans.name: Yenit Isabel

texts.es:
La Señora Yenit Isabel trabaja para una escuela pública en el municipio de Nagarote desde hace 8 años como profesora de primaria con lo que ha sacado adelante su familia que esta conforma por su esposo y dos hijos, brindándole estudio, alimentación y demás necesidades básicas del hogar.

Actualmente es su segundo crédito  que solicita a ceprodel el financiamiento anterior lo ha pagado muy bien, este que necesita es para mejorar de vivienda para comenzar a construir un cuarto con lo que pretende realizar cambio de techo, dándole una mejor condición de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Yenit Isabel works for a public school in the municipality of Nagarote. She has been working there for 8 years as a primary school teacher helping her family to get ahead. Her family is made up of her husband and two children. With her job, she has been able to provide education, food, and other basic home necessities to her family. 
She’s requesting a second loan from CEPRODEL [MFI] considering that she has paid off the last loan very well. This loan will be used to improve her house by starting to build a room, for which she needs to change the roof; thus, giving her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy zinc to change the roof for one of the bedrooms.

loans.name: Heraclea

texts.en:
Heraclea is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business making and selling brooms in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 16000 through NWTF to buy more raw materials for her brooms.

NWTF is relisting Heraclea's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials for her brooms.

loans.name: Godonou Rufin

texts.fr: Godonou Rufin est âgé de 45 ans et vit au Bénin. Godonou Rufin est marié à une marchande du nom de Gertrude. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous à leur charge. Le couple vit ensemble avec les enfants et assure ensemble les divers besoins besoins du ménage. Afin d’assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Godonou Rufin mène comme activité depuis une vingtaine d’année, la photographie dans sa région. Godonou Rufin s’approvisionne en caméras et appareils photos numériques dans sa région. Afin d’accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Godonou Rufin désire acquérir des appareils numériques et des caméras pour satisfaire la demande de ses clients. Pour ce faire, Godonou Rufin sollicite pour la troisième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt lui permettra certainement de rehausser le niveau de son activité et de se faire plus de profits. Les premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Godonou Rufin is 45 years old and lives in Benin. He is married to a merchant named Gertrude, and the couple have four dependent children. Godonou Rufin lives with his wife and children, and the couple handle the various household responsibilities together. 

To that end, Godonou Rufin started working as a photographer in his region some 20 years ago. He buys his cameras locally. 

To bolster his sales and revenue, Godonou Rufin wishes to purchase the additional cameras needed to meet customer demand. To do so, he is seeking financial assistance from ALIDé for the third time. This credit will help him to bolster his activity and to increase his profits. Past loans were repaid without incident.

loans.use: to buy cameras.

loans.name: Ramona Celina

texts.es: Ceprodel se caracteriza por Resolver las necesidades Familiares a través del financiamiento oportuno. La señora Ramona es una más de las beneficiadas  con dicho crédito, el cual le permite efectuar la actividad como es venta de ropa, por eso visito las oficinas de ceprodel para explicar su necesidad, ya que dicho crédito sería utilizado en la compra de Pacas de Ropa Usada, Actividad Anexa a su profesión como es la de Maestra de Educación Primaria, dicha actividad comercial  la ejerce con el objetivo de  mejorar sus condiciones y nivel de vida; ya que el salario no le cubre el total de las necesidades del hogar, entonces buscan estas alternativas de financiamientos y de esa manera el  bajo salario lo vuelven productivo ya que las obligaciones financiera las paga con su salario y le da la oportunidad de abastecer el inventario de su negocio y crecer a un mas, ella es soltera ya no tiene hijos  su cargo, la señora Ramona desea continuar su actividad  comercial espera incrementar su inventario y poder  lograr obtener mas ganancias y crecer en niveles de venta.
texts.en:
Ceprodel is known for resolving family financial problems when the need arises.  Ramona is one of those who has benefitted most from this type of loan, which helps her carry out her business of selling clothing.  She visited Ceprodel to explain that she needed a loan to buy packages of used clothing.  This is work she does in addition to her job as an elementary school teacher.  She holds both jobs in order to improve her living conditions and lifestyle, since her salary does not cover all of the household expenses.  Therefore she has sought alternative ways to compensate her low salary.  

The loan will allow her to buy more merchandise so she can expand her business.  She is single and has no children.  Ramona wants to continue with her commercial activity and increase her sales volume, with more inventory, in order to earn a higher profit.

loans.use: To buy dresses, shorts, men's pants and shirts, women's blouses, children's clothing, shoes. flat iron for hair, bracelets, lipstick, nail polish and other cosmetics.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en: Rosalie is 31 years old, married and living in Malaubang, Ozamis City, with her three children. To earn a living, she makes and cooks food for sale, and she's earning 5,000 a month. With the desire to improve her income, she asks for a loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC, in order to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make prepared foods for sale. She has been a member of GDMPC since 2009. In God’s time, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make prepared foods for sale.

loans.name: Nemesia

texts.en:
A married mother of six children, Nemesia works hard to support her family. 

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Nemesia is borrowing PHP 26000 through NWTF to buy raw materials for her tailoring business.

Nemesia has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en: Angeles is a 58-year-old married woman from Albur, Bohol. She has four children. Her oldest child is thirty-five while the youngest is twenty years old. She is engaged in a food vending business. She sells home cooked vegetables and snack foods at a nearby school. She requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase more sugar, cooking oil, vegetables, and meat to continue serving her customers. In the future, Angeles would like to open a sari-sari store (variety store) out of the profits generated from her food vending business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, cooking oil, vegetables and meat

loans.name: Abed Al Rahman

texts.en:
Abed Al Rahman is a 39-year-old married man and the father of five children. He has been a taxi driver since 1994. He works hard to ensure an adequate standard of living for his family. Abed Al Rahman suffers like almost all of the Palestinian refugees living in Lebanon from a lack of work opportunities, which is why he is stuck in the taxi business. 

Abed Al Rahman applied for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to do necessary maintenance on his car and to pay what is left on the price of his house. He is looking forward to buying his own car and taxi driving license to get rid of the burden of renting a car. Abed Al Rahman devotes his life to his family and works hard to satisfy them with an increased income. He is grateful for this opportunity that will help him a lot in ensuring his development.

loans.use: to do necessary maintenance on his car, and to pay what is left on the price of his house.

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Kim is 36 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been making stoves to sell for more than two years, earning approximately $13 per day. Her husband helps her run the business. Two of her children are employed, and they earn about $7 daily. 

In order to improve her business, Kim is requesting a loan of $1200 to raise capital in the business, in order to purchase materials for producing stoves to sell. By doing so, she would earn more income for the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and send her youngest child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase materials for producing stoves to sell.

loans.name: Bardhe

texts.en:
Bardhe, who is 36 years old, is married and has two children who are 4 and 9 years old.  She and her family live in the northwest of Albania. Bardhe is the only one to support her family financially through her livestock business that she has been operating it for the past ten years. She has been selling dairy products and baby animals to local markets. 

In an effort to expand her business and buy more animals, Bardhe wants to start by repairing the stable first and then expand it. She needs money for the repairs and she is requesting this loan to do just that. The loan is a small amount, 50,000 Albanian Lek, and Bardhe hopes that through lenders she will be able to collect the loan and start repairing the stable as soon as possible.

loans.use: To repair a stable as soon as possible.

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia is 29 years old, married, and has two children. Her spouse is a farmer and they both plant and harvest rice to sell. They usually earn PHP 15,000 upon harvesting and selling the crop. It goes for education fees, daily meals, and also to pay for debts from relatives. 

Celia has insufficient fund now. She is asking for PHP 26,000 to invest in improving crop production. She will use the loan for the next planting season. She will buy fertilizers and insecticides which are necessary to ensure healthy growth of crops. This will lead to a plentiful harvest and will improve the family's living condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides for crop sustainability

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.en:
Maria Luz is happily married to Eriberto and they have two children. They are both farmers from Padul and they have managed two hectares of rice fields for almost 10 years now. They earn PHP 30,000 twice a year (during harvest season). The income goes for meals, school expenses, and bills at home. The rest of their income serves as additional revolving capital for the farming business. 

Maria Luz would like to improve their farming practices to raise healthier crops but this requires additional capital. To meet her goal, she is now asking for a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides and pay for farm labor. 

Someday, with a good income and profitable farming business, Maria Luz and her family will live fortunately.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides and to pay for farm labor.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 43 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

Edna runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. She has been in this business for eleven years and has previously received funds through Kiva. Edna aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Angelito

texts.es:
El Señor  Angelito tiene 57 años de edad, es casado, reside en compañía de su esposa  en  el municipio de Choloma, Departamento de Cortés.
Angelito tiene 35 años de dedicarse al transporte de personas a través de un taxi. Considera que la actividad que realiza le provee los ingresos necesarios para la subsistencia de su familia.
En la actualidad ha solicitado un préstamo por la cantidad de 25,000 Lempiras, los que piensa invertir en la compra de cemento, laminas de zinc, madera y accesorios para la reconstrucción del garaje y corredor además realizar reparaciones menores de su vivienda (reparación de 2 puertas).
El espera mantener en buen estado su unidad de transporte para continuar brindando su servicio a sus clientes.
Agradece el apoyo que ha recibido de la institución ya que ha obtenido varios créditos los cuales ha podido administrar de la mejor manera.
texts.en:
Angelito, 57, is married and lives with his wife in the municipality of Choloma in the department of Cortes.  Angelito is 35 years old, and he provides taxi services.   Through this work, he generates the income he needs to support his family.

At this time, he is requesting a loan in the sum of 25,000 Honduran lempiras.  He plans to use this loan to buy cement, wood, sheets of corrugated metal, and other supplies to rebuild his garage and patio.  He also wants to make some minor repairs to his house (to repair 2 doors).

He hopes to keep his taxi in good condition so that he can continue to provide service to  his customers.

He appreciates the support that he has received from the institution, because he has obtained a number of loans which have helped him to manage his business better.

loans.use: to invest in building supplies (cement, sheets of laminated metal roofing material, wood, and other supplies) to rebuild his garage, patio, and 2 doors in his house

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.en:
Teodoro, who lives at Padul, has been an experienced farmer for 18 years. He inherited farming practices from his parents. He is now 40 years old, happily married, and has three children. He is planting and harvesting rice to sell. Teodoro also hired additional laborers who helped him plant and transplant rice seedlings on his two-hectare rice field. 

Teodoro wants to improve his crop production, but has insufficient funds to do so. So, he is now asking for a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy rice seeds, 10 bags of urea (fertilizer), and pesticides for crop sustainability. With the help of this loan, he will ensure a healthy growth of crops which will lead to higher production upon harvest. His income will be used for education, meals, and bills at home. 

In the future, Teodoro would like to earn good profits from his business that will help lift his family out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, 10 bags of urea (fertilizer), and pesticides for crop sustainability.

loans.name: Allan

texts.en: Allan, a 40-year-old, is a married entrepreneur of Tabid, Ozamis City. He has 4 children and is earning from his vulcanizing business. It has been running for almost 8 years now and he earns 7,000 PHP a month. To improve his business, he borrowed 8,000 PHP from GDMPC micro credit which he had just joined in 2011, to purchase materials needed to expand the services he provides. He hopes to expand his business before long.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed for his vulcanizing business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 55 years old and married with nine children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

Elizabeth runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries to sell in her (variety) sari-sari store. She has been in this business for two years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Elizabeth aspires to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en: Editha, who has six children, lives in Kinuman Norte, Ozamis City. She is 49 years old and married. Editha has owned and operated a corn and coconut production business for 8 years and earns 8,000 PHP from this business. She requested a loan of 13,500 PHP to buy fertilizer. In 2010, Editha joined GDMPC. In the future, Editha wants to make improvements to her house and improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser.

loans.name: Purev

texts.en:
Purev is a 60-year-old accountant who lives with his family in the outer ger district of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. This area lacks basic infrastructure. Purev is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase necessary housing materials in order to renovate the interior or his current house.

He said: “With the help of this loan, I can make better living conditions for my lovely children and especially for my kind wife.”

loans.use: to purchase housing materials to renovate the interior of his house.

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
Norah is 22 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past three years, Norah has been working hard to manage her clothing business, through which she sells baby clothes. 

To help expand her business, Norah has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale and will help Norah to generate greater profits and maintain her family. Norah hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business. 

Norah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Zeinat

texts.en: Zeinat is a 44-year-old married woman, the mother of four children. Her family is her only concern in life, and she always aims to provide them with a better living, especially since they are Palestinian refugees in Lebanon and don't have the same minimum decent living standard as others do. For this reason, Zeinat helps her husband by operating her small clothing shop, which she opened in 2009, after seven years of prior experience in this field. To increase her family's income, and to make sure she can work at a good level, she applied for  a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, in order to increase her collection of new clothes for the winter season to satisfy her clients' needs, and to renew her shop's decoration. Zeinat has a  good reputation and is well known for her excellent customer service. She is always looking for ways to expand her shop and introduce her customers to new clothing-related items, such as accessories, shoes, perfumes etc. Zeinat is very proud of herself and the level her business has reached.

loans.use: to increase her collection of new clothes for the winter season and satisfy her customers' needs.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 42 years old, married, and has seven children.

Imelda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell at her store.

Imelda has been in this business for five years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Imelda aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell at her store.

loans.name: Nar

texts.fr: Madame Nar est une femme mariée qui habite dans l’une des banlieues sénégalaises. Elle s’active depuis plus de 20ans dans le secteur du commerce. Elle exerce la vente de bonbons, jus glace et habits traditionnels. Elle est membre de l’un des guichets de l’UIMCEC de la banlieue et a déjà remboursé 8 crédits antérieurs. Elle sollicite un prêt de 300 000 frs prévu pour acheter des habits traditionnels qu’elle va revendre à sa clientèle. Avec l’augmentation de ses bénéfices elle veut augmenter son fond de roulement. Elle projette dans le futur de disposer d’un magasin de stockage de grande envergure.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nar is a married woman who lives in a Senegalese suburb. She has been in sales for over 20 years selling candy, juice, ice cream and traditional apparel. She is a member of a local UIMCEC branch and has already obtained and repaid eight previous loans. 

She is seeking a loan of 300,000 F to purchase traditional apparel for resale. She will use the extra revenue to bolster her working capital. In the coming years, she would like to have a large store.

loans.use: to buy traditional apparel for resale.

loans.name: San Antonio Group

texts.es:
La señora Maria esta soltera, tiene 23 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, se dedica a ala artesanía, específicamente la confección y bordado de blusas, inicio este negocio como empleada y hasta el momento lleva 6 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de materiales para producción mas blusas y poder recuperar su inversión con las ganancias que obtenga, espera el el futuro tener operarias para su negocio. Las demás integrantes se dedican a la crianza de animales, al bordado, trabajo domésticos y a la agricultura.
texts.en:
Maria is single, 23 years old, and did not have the opportunity to study. She makes a living making handicrafts, specifically sewing and embroidery of blouses. She began this business as an employee and now has 6 years of experience. 

Maria organized a group to be able to apply for a loan, which she will use to buy materials to make more blouses and recover her investment with the profits she makes. In the future she hopes to employ workers for her business. 

The other members make their livings raising animals, doing embroidery, domestic work and farming.

loans.use: to buy thread, fabric and patterns

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase materials for constructing a dairy unit

loans.name: Fame - 26 Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento FAME  está  compuesto por nueve integrantes ocho  mujeres y un varón,   la presidenta del  banco es la Sra.  Ruth tiene 51 años, es casada tiene tres  hijos de las edades de 10, 12 y 18 años,  ella se dedica al trabajo independiente en una consultora donde realiza trabajos para distintas áreas y va a usar este préstamo para invertir en su negocio con la compra de distintos materiales de escritorio como hojas y boligrafos que necesita, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  Trabajo, la Sra. Ruth va  a utilizar los beneficios en seguir mejorando su actividad y así mejorando sus ingresos, La Sra. Ruth es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella ya sus compañeras del grupo ya que en muchos casos son personas que sacan adelante solas a sus familias
texts.en: The entrepreneurship group FAME is comprised of 9 members, 8 women and 1 man. The president of the bank is Ruth. She is 51 years old, married, and has 3 children who are 10, 12, and 18 years old. She works for herself in a consultancy and performs work in different areas. She is going to use the loan to invest in her business by buying various materials that she needs such as folders and pens. Her reason for requesting this loan is to keep improving her business. Ruth is going to use the profits to continue improving her business and so to improve her income. Ruth is a very hardworking person and is happy that this opportunity has been offered to her and the other members of the group as, in many cases, they are the only ones who are helping their families to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy materials such as pens and folders at wholesale prices

loans.name: Phorn

texts.en:
Phorn is 57 years old. She is married and resides with one child in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries and food for more than a year, earning approximately $7 per day. Her husband is a rice farmer who earns about $5 each day. 

Phorn is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase metal to build a roof. In the future, she would like to run a restaurant and help her child to study Korea. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her house to make it more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: to purchase metal to build a roof

loans.name: Numa

texts.es: Numa  de 40 años de edad vive al sur de la ciudad y se dedica a la elaboración de bolsos para damas,  desde hace 20 años, cuando trabajando en una fábrica de bolsos donde aprendió y poco a poco empezó a adecuar su infraestructura técnica; primero compró una maquina plana, posteriormente una devastadora  y fue  consiguiendo paso a paso su clientela, la que al final lo llevó a independizarse en su propia aventura de negocios. En la actualidad está en la cadena de tercerización maquilando, al diversos almacenes, que le proporcionan el material básico, como cuero, artesanías compradas a los indígenas wayuu, en el departamento de la Guajira, al norte de Colombia.   Así mismo el también trabaja por su propia cuenta, en las tareas de diseño, corte, confección y acabado piezas. Sus ventas las realiza a crédito, mientras que sus compras las hace de contado en almacenes especializados de cuero e insumos para desarrollar los artículos que produce. Su meta es ampliar su negocio y agregarle, adicionado más tecnología a sus procesos. Pero su mayor desafío, es lograr tener un capital de trabajo suficiente, para cumplir sus propósitos de crecimiento. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento, que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará una máquina de codos, insumos como hilos, hebillas, herrajes, con lo cual aspira a mejorar la calidad de sus productos y aumentar sus posibilidades de ventas,  en otros mercados locales, lo que  muy seguramente Numa  logrará, pues es muy trabajador y persistente en alcanzar sus metas.
texts.en:
Numa is 40 years old and lives in the south of the city.  He has been manufacturing ladies' handbags for 20 years.  He learned his trade while working in a handbag factory and gradually began adapting his technical equipment; first of all, he bought a table top sewing machine and then a trimmer, and gradually started to build up his clientele.  This led him to go it alone in his own business venture.  He currently forms part of an outsourcing chain which supplies different stores, who, in turn, supply basic materials, such as leather and handicrafts purchased from the Wayuu tribe, in Guajira department, in the North of Colombia.  At the same time, he also works freelance, designing, cutting, sewing and finishing items.  He sells his goods on credit, while he pays in cash in the specialized stores where he goes to buy leather and other supplies necessary for the production of his goods.

His aim is to expand his business and add to it by employing more technology in his processes.  But his greatest challenge is to build up sufficient working capital to carry out his expansion plans.  He is currently applying for a Kiva loan, his first funding, from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to enable him to buy a butt-seaming machine and materials such as thread and buckles.  This, he hopes, will allow him to improve the quality of his products and increase their sales potential in other local markets.  Such is Numa's hard work and determination, that he will certainly achieve his goals.

loans.use: to purchase a joint machine and thread, buckles, and fittings

loans.name: Yamileth Del Socorro

texts.es: La Señora Yamileth  es una Mujer emprendedora, la profesión es maestra de educación primaria, la que ejerce en un colegio de león,  pero en las vacaciones se dedica a la elaboración de pasteles como otra  Alternativa económica, ya que tiene la facilidad por que su mama es propietaria de una panadería y ella aprendió dicho oficio, el que hoy lo utiliza para su propio beneficio,  una de las necesidades importante que tiene actualmente es tener un financiamiento, por eso hace la solicitud a ceprodel para poder  realizar la compra de arina, manteca, aceite, azúcar, queso, bolsa, alquiler, margarina y levadura, para solo dedicarse a la elaboración del producto,  es soltera con 1 hijo el que le da todo el cuidado que merece, ya que el esfuerzo que realiza lo hace por el mejoramiento de las condiciones del nivel de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Yamileth is an enterprising woman and a professional primary education teacher employed at a school in Leon. During vacation time, as an economic alternative, she makes pastries. Her mother is proprietor of a bakery. Yamileth learned the trade from her, and today, uses this skill for her own benefit.

One of the important necessities she currently has is financing. For that reason, she is requesting a loan through Ceprodel to purchase flour, lard, oil, sugar, cheese, margarine, and yeast, plus bags, in order to make her pastries. 

Yamileth is single with 1 son, for whom she provides all the care he deserves, and all her efforts go for the improvement of their conditions and level of family life.

loans.use: to buy flour, lard, oil, sugar, cheese, margarine, and yeast for her pastries, plus bags, and to pay the rent.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en: Perlita, a 38-year-old married woman, has four children. She is from Liposong, Ozamiz City. To make a living, Perlita grows bananas to sell. She has been in this business doing for ten years. She earns 4,600 PHP a month. Perlita is requesting a loan of 6,500 PHP, which she will use to obtain farm fertilizer. Perlita joined GDMPC in 2007. She plans to use the additional revenue that is generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to obtain fertilizer for her banana farm.

loans.name: Enrequita

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Enrequita works hard to support her family. She has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Enrequita is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy materials needed for her business.

Enrequita has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF, more recently with Kiva support. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Jose Gilberto

texts.es: Jose tiene 41 años de edad, vive en una aldea del municipio de Tela, Atlántida con su conyugue y sus tres hijos. Jose anteriormente realizaba actividades agrícolas y hace 6 años decidió establecer su propio negocio de una pulpería para generar mayores ingresos para el hogar. La pulpería es administrada por él y su esposa quienes atienden todo el día a sus clientes. Para mantener surtido su negocio ha decidido solicitar otro préstamo que es por 27,000 Lempiras, va comprar frijoles, arroz, harina, azúcar, sal, pan, manteca, carnes,  refrescos y lácteos. Ha manejado cuatro préstamos con este actual, los cuales le han ayudado a incrementar su inventario y su clientela. Tiene como meta hacer crecer más el negocio y que le genere buenas ganancias para apoyar a sus hijos con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Jose, age 41, lives in a village in the Tela municipality in Atlántida.  He lives with his wife and their three children.  Jose’s previous business activity was agriculture.  Six years ago he decided to establish his own business, a grocery store, in order to generate greater income for the household.

He and his wife run the grocery store, and they wait on their customers all day.  In order to keep his business stocked he has decided to request another loan for 27,000 lempiras.  He will buy beans, rice, flour, sugar, salt, bread, shortening, meat, soft drinks, and dairy products.

He has managed four loans, counting this one.  They have helped him increase his inventory and his clientele.  His goal is to make his business grow more and to have it generate good income so that he can support his children’s education.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, flour, sugar, salt, bread, shortening, meat, soft drinks, dairy products, and other groceries to stock his store and sell.

loans.name: Nov

texts.en:
Nov, age 37, is a rice farmer in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She earns additional income by raising animals. She has been engaged in both these businesses for more than 20 years, earning approximately $5 daily. 

Nov resides with her husband and five children. Her husband (shown with her in the picture) helps her run the business. Two of her children are garment factory employees, each of whom earns about $8 each day. 

Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Nov is requesting a loan in the amount of $1,400 to purchase a motorcycle for her children to use to commute to work. This purchase will help her reduce the family's transportation expenses. 

In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she plans to build a new house for the family as soon as she has the money to do so.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for her children to use to commute to work

loans.name: Rufa

texts.en:
Rufa, age 43, raises hogs to earn a living. She lives in Antequera, Bohol, with her husband and their three children, who are between the ages of eight and 16. 

She earns two thousand pesos a month from her hog-raising business. During her spare time, she also makes fans and hats made of dried buri (palm) leaves, which she offers for sale in order to gain additional income. 

Rufa has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 5,000 to buy feed for her hogs and also to use as additional capital to buy more dried buri so that she can produce more fans and hats. In the future, Rufa would like to expand her business by investing in other business ventures. Her goals are to support her family and to ensure the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy feed for her hogs and also to use as additional capital to buy more dried buri, which she uses to make fans and hats

loans.name: Maria Paz

texts.es: La Sra. Maria sigue con la actividad de la venta de ropa, cuenta que le fue muy bien con el anterior crédito ya que siempre esta diversificando sus productos, en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de ropa lijera  como poleras y camisas, ya que es época de calor y tiene mucha demanda de estos productos y ella siempre dele gusta ofrecer variedad de productos a su clientela y asi de esta manera incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Señora Maria continues to work selling clothes. She says that her previous loan went very well because she is constantly diversifying her products. 

This time, she is applying for a loan to buy light clothing such as sweatshirts and shirts. That's because warm season and demand for these products is high. She always likes to offer a variety of products to her customers and in this way increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy wholesale sweatshirts and shirts

loans.name: Nermin's Group

texts.en:
Nermin is a 38-year-old Iraqi woman. She is married and is a mother of 5 children. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Nermin is one of the many Iraqi woman who is working from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

Nermin learned to sew years ago and she has 2 years experience with her little home-based sewing and tailoring business. To improve her work and be able to offer greater variety of services to her customers, she would like to buy some new tools and quality materials to work with. She would also like to make an investment and buy a new sewing machine and a small generator to allow her to work during the random and rather frequent power cuts in the city. To be able to make these purchases Nermin took a loan from Relief International - Microfinance Iraq.  

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers group loans for clients unable to provide a guarantor - thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of 3 to 5 clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and a small generator

loans.name: Jose Alexander

texts.es: El joven Jose  tiene 22 años, es técnico electrónico, su taller lo tiene ubicado en la calle muy concurrida ahí brinda servicio técnico en reparación de televisores, computadoras, dvd´s, radios y todo tipo de aparatos electrónicos, vive en la zona de Pacata  en casa de su mamá pero el es un joven responsable ya que ayuda  con los gastos en alimentación y en educación a su, mama y a sus hermanos, ambos trabajan muy duro por el bienestar de sus hijos, Jose hace poco también incursionó en el negocio de la compra venta de televisores, ahora el crédito que solicita es para la compra de repuestos   y así poder arreglarlos y venderlos obtenido ganancias y así incrementar su capital en este nuevo emprendimiento, el joven Jose trabaja con la institución demostrando responsabilidad con sus pagos.
texts.en:
Jose is twenty-two years old and is an electronic technician.  His workshop is located on a busy street, and he offers technical service in repairing televisions, computers, DVD players, radios, and all types of electronic devices.  

He lives in the Pacata area in his mother's house, but he is a responsible young man; he already helps with the food and education expenses for his mother and siblings.  

They work very hard for the well-being of their children.  Jose recently ventured into the business of buying and selling televisions.  The loan that he is requesting is to buy spare parts in order to be able to fix and sell electronic devices, increasing profits and capital in this new undertaking.  Jose works with the institution, demonstrating responsibility with his repayments.

loans.use: to buy spare parts.

loans.name: Nurije

texts.en:
Nurije is an Egyptian from one of the two most vulnerable ethnic minority communities of Albania and a mother of two independent children. She is retired and receives a pension, yet she works at her children’s businesses as well. In addition, she looks after her husband, who is been paralyzed for almost a decade.

A couple of weeks ago, Nurije experienced home fires because of faulty electrical home wiring. She managed to repair the house with her savings and with help from her children; however, to prevent the same thing happening again, she needs to change the wiring system, which electricians have told her was installed incorrectly.

In order to make this happen, she is applying for a loan. She hopes that lenders will show understanding and help her.

loans.use: to correct faulty electrical home wiring and thereby protect her house from another fire

loans.name: Ruby Ann

texts.en:
Ruby Ann is 22 years old, married, and has one child. She works very hard to provide for her family. Ruby Ann runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional grocery items to sell at her store.
