texts.en: Tojigul is a young woman of 24. She is married and has 1 child. Her husband works for the government, and Tojigul raises cattle at home and sells milk. She currently has 3 head of cattle and a dairy cow that gives 10 litres of milk per day. From the early morning, neighbours come to her house to buy milk. She also has a few head of smaller livestock. She has been working in animal husbandry from childhood, as this is what her parents had done their whole lives. Tojigul dreams of raising her child as best she can and giving him an education. She is planning to use the loan to increase the number of cattle she owns and to expand her business. She is grateful to Arvand and hopes for support.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy on overlock sewing machine.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es: El señor Jorge Wilfredo tiene 27 años, estudio hasta nivel bachillerato y no pudo ingresar a la universidad debido a que sus padres son personas de escasos recursos, tiene hermanos menores los cuales se encuentran en el colegio; actualmente vive en la zona de Sacaba - Cochabamba - Bolivia, convive con la señora Ana Mabel hace mas de tres años, tienen un hijo pequeño que vive junto a ellos. El señor Jorge trabaja de camarero de lunes a sábado hace mas de tres años y su esposa trabaja de recepcionista de lunes a sábado hace dos años, también cuenta con un segunda actividad que es la venta de ropa durante los últimos meses del año, tiene experiencia hace mas de 5 años debido a que le colaboraba a su madre. El crédito que solicitan es para aumentar su capital para la venta de ropa, lo que les permitirá tener un mayor crecimiento en su actividad y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Jorge Wilfredo, 27, completed high school but could not attend college because his parents did not have sufficient resources. He has younger brothers who are in high school. He has been living in the area of Sacaba, Cochabamba in Bolivia with Ana Mabel for more than three years. Their young son lives with them.

For three years, Jorge has worked as a waiter from Monday to Saturday. His wife has been a receptionist for two years and works Monday to Saturday. During the final months of the year in the past five years, he and his mother have also sold clothing. This loan will be used to increase capital to buy clothing and, therefore, grow their business and earn more income.

loans.use: to buy clothing merchandise.

loans.name: Gloria Del Carmen

texts.es:
La Señora Gloria del Carmen,  es dueña de  una tienda  de ropa y zapatos usados ubicada  cerca de la terminal de buses en la ciudad de León sale de su casa a la 6:30 am y abre su negocio a las 7:00 am  cerrándolo  a las 6:00 pm, realiza este trabajo para apoyar a su esposo en  el sustento de su familia desde hace 5 años.

Doña Gloria está solicitando este crédito para comprar Pacas de ropa y zapatos de diferente estilo, compra su mercadería  en la ciudad de Managua dos veces por semana,  ofrece desde muy temprana hora a toda su clientela la variedad de productos  la que atiende con su Hija de 20 años de edad. 

Doña Gloria debido a que se aproxima la navidad se acercó a la oficina de Ceprodel a solicitar crédito para surtir su negocio con nuevos productos de mejor calidad y así aprovechar la ocasión y satisfacer la necesidad de su clientela, los sueños de Doña Gloria son que su negocio siga creciendo.
texts.en:
Gloria del Carmen owns a used clothing and shoe store located near the bus terminal in the city of Leon. She leaves her house at 6:30am and opens her store at 7am closing it at 6pm. She does this job, 5 years now, to help her husband support the family.

Gloria is requesting this loan to buy bales of clothing and shoes in different styles, to buy merchandise in the city of Managua twice a week and to offer all her clients, at a very early hour, a variety of products with her assistance and that of her 20-year-old daughter.

With Christmas approaching, Gloria went to the office of Ceprodel to apply for a loan to supply her business with new products of better quality and thus taking the opportunity to meet the needs of her customers. Gloria’s dream is for her business to continue growing.

loans.use: to buy bales of clothing and shoes in different styles

loans.name: Ma. Susan

texts.en:
Susan manages a little sari-sari store (community-based store) in her village. Managing her store is her way of helping her husband generate income for their family's needs. She sells a variety of goods in her store, where she earns at least 500.00 PHP a day. 

To further develop her store, Susan is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000. She plans to use the loan to purchase groceries in bulk that she will sell in her store. She wants to sustain her business because it assists not only their family, but also their farming needs. 

Susan is already 49 years old and married to Efren, a farmer in their community. They live in the rural area of Barangay San Juan province of Isabela. The couple was blessed with three children. Susan hopes that with their sacrifices in the businesses, they may able to continue support their children’s education until they finish college.

loans.use: to purchase groceries in bulk to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is widowed with four children, and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. 

Ruth has a business selling green bananas and has been in this business for 12 years. She works at the market seven days a week and sells on a retail basis. 

She has applied for a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings from Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas. She doesn’t have any other income-generating activity. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. 

Ruth aspires to becoming a wholesaler and also to buy a plot of land and to build her own house. She resides in a rented house, and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent, school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 29 years old, married and the mother of one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Jennifer has a trisikad transportation business in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to buy spare parts for her trisikad.

Jennifer has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her trisikad.

loans.name: Roseville

texts.en:
Roseville, a 38-year-old married mother of three children, all in school, is a very hardworking entrepreneur. The operator of a jeepney transportation business in the Philippines for five years, she has requested a PHP 22000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts for her vehicle.

Roseville would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her jeepney.

loans.name: Khurshed

texts.ru:
Хуршед житель города Вахдат. Ему 25 лет. Он женат. У него один ребенок. Хуршед хочет заняться животноводством.  Чтобы начать свою деятельность ему необходимо закупить коров. 
Хуршед берет кредит для закупа коров. Он очень надеется на Вашу помощь.
texts.en: Khurshed lives in Vahdat. He is 25 years old, married, and has 1 child. Khurshed wants to work in animal husbandry. In order to start his business, he needs to buy cattle, so he is seeking a loan to purchase cows. He is really hoping for your assistance.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Oscar Manuel

texts.es:
Oscar, quiere aumentar la capacidad del negocio de ropa, comprándose mas variedad en blusas, camisas, y otros artículos variados para mejorar la capacidad del negocio, considera que esta inversión le dara una mejor solvencia para continuar mejorando sus ventas.
Con el préstamo anterior tuvo un efecto positivo, compro mas mercadería y mejoro las ventas, sus ingresos fueron mas y hasta el momento el negocio es rentable.
texts.en: Oscar wants to grow his clothing business by buying a wider range of blouses, shirts, and other items. He thinks this investment is the solution to growth and improved sales. His previous loan was successful; he bought more merchandise and increased his sales while making a profit.

loans.use: to buy blouses and shirts.

loans.name: Loreto

texts.en:
Loreto raises crops, and now he plans to invest in starting a piggery, for an additional source of income of the family. He wishes to have a loan of 50,000 PHP to buy piglets, and feed for their maintenance. Loreto hopes to manage a hog-raising business in their village.

Loreto is lucky, being married to a patient housekeeper who is his partner in forming a God-fearing family. He is a responsible father of two children, who are going to school. Loreto wishes to send his children to school until college and finish their education. He will strive and manage the business well, to generate income for the future of his children.

loans.use: to buy his first piglets, and feed for their maintenance.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is a 47-years-old married woman and is engaged in the fishing business. Her husband works as a fisherman. This is the source of their income.

Emelita needs additional capital for the expansion of their fishing business. She is requesting a loan to buy  fishing materials such as fishing nets, lead weights, buckets and other items. With this loan her husband will be able to augment his daily catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.

In the future, Emelita dreams of improving their way of living and to experience the fullness of life together with her family.

loans.use: to buy  fishing materials such as fishing nets, lead weights, buckets and other items.

loans.name: Old Mana Group

texts.en:
This group is from a place called Teshie where everyone in the community belongs to any form of religion of their choice.

Benjamin is the leader of this group. He is 51-years-old and married to Patience, 45, who is a trader. They have 2 children, Grace, 25, and Patrick, 20, both in school.

He is a maize supplier who supplies corn to customers in and around the Teshie Township. He has been doing this work for ten years and comments that the maize business is very profitable since it is a consumable commodity. His income has improved considerably. He needs GHC1200 to buy enough maize to supply his customers. He is working hard to buy a milling machine that would be used to mill some of the maize since some customers prefer the corn dough.

The group is made up of Lawrence, Matilda, Ellis, Edmund, Charity, Deborah, Josephine, Benjamin and Doris who sell fried rice, fish, electrical appliances, provisions, ladies bags, cooking utensils and drinks respectively. They need a total amount of GHC6450 to expand their businesses.

loans.use: to buy maize (corn) and to supply his customers.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Rowena works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling purified drinking water in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling dried fish. Rowena is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase more plastic containers for her purified drinking water business.

Rowena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more plastic containers for her purified drinking water business.

loans.name: Yunus

texts.ru: История доказывает, что таджики с ранних времен занимались скотоводством и успешно справлялись с этим видом деятельности. Юнус более 10 лет продолжает бизнес своих предков и зарабатывает на жизнь. Ему 45 лет. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Детям 13 и 15 лет. Он очень успешно справляется бизнесом. Юнус имеет 3 голов крупно рогатого скота и хочет развивать бизнес дальше, но не имеет достаточного средства для этого. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 650 долларов США для покупки скота. Он ждет вашу доброту. Давайте, вместе поможем хорошему человеку!
texts.en: History shows that from the earliest times, Tajiks have been raising cattle and have been very successful in this field. For more than 10 years, Yunus has been earning a living by continuing his ancestors' occupation. He is 45 years old, married, and has 2 children, ages 13 and 15. He is successful in his work. He has 3 head of cattle and wants to further develop his business, but does not have the financial means to do so. He is seeking a loan of 650 US dollars to buy cattle. He is waiting for your kind assistance. Let's help this good man together!

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Maria De La Paz

texts.es:
María, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, para la compra de materiales para el negocio como maíz, leña, papel, bolsas, que son necesarias para seguir produciendo, además se comprara  unos balcones para las puertas de la vivienda, esto ayudara a mejorar su negocio y la seguridad de la vivienda.
Con el préstamo anterior, tuvo un efecto positivo, ya que realizo la compra de  maíz, leña y productos para una pequeña tienda,ademas una plancha, en su familia se han mantenido las condiciones estables, en este tiempo ha permanecido surtida la pequeña tienda.
texts.en:
María is requesting a new loan to buy materials for her business, like corn, wood, paper, and bags which are necessary to run her business. She will also buy a few balconies for the doors in her home. This will help improve her business and the safety of her home.
Her previous loan had a positive effect. She purchased corn, wood, and other products for her small shop in addition to an iron. Her family has maintained the store and the small shop has remained stocked.

loans.use: to buy corn, wood, paper, bags, and balconies for the doors in her home.

loans.name: Steven Jose

texts.es:
Steven es un joven de 18 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con sus padres y hermanos, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superacion; lamentablemente Steven aun no ha podido estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le gustaría mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta distraerse viendo televisión y en algunas ocasiones su mamá cocina una riquísima Carapulcra con Sopa Seca para engreírlo, ya que esta es su comida favorita.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Steven trabaja como operario de planta en un empresa textil de su ciudad, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor, él puede trabajar un aproximado de 12 horas, a veces puede trabajar en turnos rotativos, él se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Steven se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, él desea poder hacer el pintado, tarrajeo y puesta de piso de concreto en su hogar; de esta manera Steven tendrá su hogar en mejores condiciones, que aseguren el bienestar y seguridad de su familia, así pues Steven espera seguir trabajando y esforzándose poco a poco lograr su gran sueño de ser un buen profesional y tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Steven, 18, is single and lives in the city of Chincha with his parents and siblings. He is very likeable, hardworking, and enthusiastic and has the desire to get ahead. Sadly, Steven has not been able to study a profession, but he would like to do so. In his free time, he likes to watch television. Sometimes, his mother cooks his favorite, delicious local dish, Carapulcra con Sopa Seca, to spoil him. 

On his own initiative and with hard work and dedication, Steven works as a plant operator for a textile company in the city. He works every day from early in the morning, and he can work about 12 hours a day. Sometimes, he works in rotating shifts. He likes his job and thinks he is doing well because of his hard work and friendly manner toward others.

Steven thanks the Kiva lenders, whose help will let him make improvements to his house. He wants to paint, plaster, and pour a concrete floor in his home. Steven´s house will be in better repair, which will assure the well-being and safety of his family. He hopes to keep working hard so that slowly he will achieve his great dream to have a profession and to own his own house.

loans.use: to make improvements to his house.

loans.name: Neang

texts.en:
Neang is 40 years old. She is married and resides with four children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. 

She has been involved in growing rice and fattening up animals for more than twenty years, earning approximately $28 per day. Her husband helps her run the business. Two of her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $6 daily. 

Neang is requesting a loan of $1,500 to purchase fertilizer, fuel and pesticide to use for farming. This money will help her crops grow well and provide high yields. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn Bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, fuel and pesticide to use for farming.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy coffee plants and to cleanup the plantation.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Rosita works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a local eatery.  Rosita is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her store.

Rosita has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is 62 years old and married with two children. Magdalena works very hard to provide for them.

Magdalena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 10000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her store. Magdalena has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as rice, soft drinks, detergents, and other miscellaneous items. 

In the future Magdalena would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of items such as rice, soft drinks, and detergents to sell in her store.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Julita works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. 

Julita is borrowing 16000 PHP through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Julita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en: Zenaida works hard to support her family. She is married and has a rag-making business in the Philippines. Zenaida requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy materials needed for her rag-making business. She has been in this business for six years. In the future, Zenaida would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her rag-making business.

loans.name: Lay Huch

texts.en:
Lay Huch is 26 years old. She is married and resides with one child in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in cultivating rice and breeding pigs for more than five years, earning approximately $6 daily. Her husband is a mechanic who earns about $8 each day. 

Due to the difficulty with her family’s transportation, Lay Huch is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase would enable her to use the saved money on her transportation expenses to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to expand her business and send her child to a good school. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Demetria

texts.es: La señora Demetria tiene 29 años de edad madre soltera con 1 hijo menor dependiente, vive y trabaja en la comunidad de Liriuni sector ex-tranca cuartel Barrientos sobre la carretera Cbba-Santa Cruz cuenta con un kiosco de productos, gaseosas, lácteos, galletas y otros vende a los turistas, pasajeros, choferes cuenta con una experiencia de 3 años. Doña Demetria necesitaba capital para aumentar los productos para su kiosco, el capital que tenía le presto para dos meses a su hermano para que compra una vivienda, el cual no ha devuelto todavía y ella necesita de urgencia un capital, Demetria nos comenta que su sueño es tener una casa propia las ganancias va ahorrar para hacer construir una casa para darle a su hijo un futuro mejor y también para sacarlo adelante en sus estudios.
texts.en:
Demetria, 29, is a single mother with one young son. She lives and works in the community of Liriuni, in the Barrientos neighborhood. She has a kiosk along the Cochabamba - Santa Cruz highway with soft drinks, diary products, cookies, and other things that she sells to tourists, passengers, and drivers. She has three years of experience. 

Demetria needs capital to increase the products at her kiosk. She lent the capital she had to her brother for two months so that he could buy a house. He hasn't returned it yet and she needs the money urgently. Demetria told us that her dream is to have her own house. She is going to save her earnings so that she can build a house in order to give her son a better future and also move him forward in his studies.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to increase her sales.

loans.name: 32-Azucenas Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento 32-AZUCENAS está  compuesto por Nueve integrantes siete mujeres, y dos varones, la presidenta del  banco es la Sra. Ysabel,   tiene 24 años casada con un  hijo de la edad de tres años, La Sra. Ysabel se dedica  a la venta de zapatos en especial de chinelas, tiene su puesto de venta en la zona de Cruce Taquiña  de la  ciudad de Cochabamba,  este préstamo es su  cuarta secuencia  dentro de la institución, la Sra. Ysabel  va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de de variedad de chinelas  y así de esta manera ofrecer variedad de productos a su clientela, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Ysabel va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando variedad productos, la Sra. Ysabel es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella ya sus compañeras de grupo ya que en algunos casos mantienen solas a sus familias.
texts.en: The 32-Azucenas communal bank is made up of nine members, seven women and two men. The president of the bank is Ysabel. She is 24 years old and married with a three-year-old son. Ysabel sells shoes, especially flip-flops. She has a stand in the Cruce Taquiña area of the city of Cochabamba. This loan is her fourth cycle in the institution. Ysabel is going to use the loan to buy a variety of flip-flops and in this way offer a variety of products to her customers. Her reason for asking for this loan is to continue improving her business. Ysabel is going to use the profits to continue buying a variety of products. Ysabel is a very hard-working person. She feels happy about the opportunity given to her and her fellow members in the group, since in some cases they are the sole support for their families.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of flip-flops

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase equipment used in shoemaking.

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Ms. Zubaida is a 47-year-old married woman. She is efficiently running an ice cream cart with her husband. The woman shown in the photo is Zubaida, as she usually uses a veil due to societal restrictions. The man in the photo is Zubaida’s husband. 

Both are working together happily in order to cater to the needs of the eight family members. Zubaida is an expert in making ice cream at home, while her husband assists her by selling the ice cream door-to-door in their community. 

Zubaida is a mother of six; three of them are school-going. She needs to cover their educational expenses with other expenses. 

For the expansion of her business, she is planning to buy another cart to start the sales from their home as well. Zubaida for the first time contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs 10,000. This will increase their sales, which will ultimately help in generating more earnings.

loans.use: to buy another cart for her ice cream business.

loans.name: Sharon's Group

texts.en:
Sharon's group is comprised of two hard working women. 

Sharon is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga, in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, with one of them currently in school. For the past three years, Sharon has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells rice, sugar, and soap. 

To help expand her business, Sharon has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more products for the shop, such as cooking oil and sugar, and will help Sharon to generate greater profits. The profits help to pay for her children's schooling. 

Sharon hopes that in the future she will be able to be a successful woman.

Sharon is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more products, such as cooking oil and sugar, for resale in the shop.

loans.name: Roman

texts.es: El señor Roman, es una persona de 58 años de edad de estado civil viudo pero actualmente vive en concubinato con su segunda pareja, alcanzo a estudiar la primaria, vive en su casa propia y cuenta con dos dependientes económicos a cargo los cuales son sus pequeños hijos; la actividad económica a la que se dedica es la producción agrícola; produce papa, haba, arveja y cebada en sus terrenos que cuentan con riego por inundación las cuales se hallan situadas en la comunidad de Minas Pampa del municipio de Tíraque distante aproximadamente a unos 77 Km. desde la ciudad de Cochabamba. Y finalmente el cliente y su conyugue manifiestan tener ganas de seguir incrementando su producción agrícola y para tal efecto se ven en la necesidad de solicitar capital de inversión para la compra de abono de gallinaza y semilla de papa certificada que son  insumos elementales para obtener un mejor rendimiento de este cultivo y del forma obtener mayores ingresos económicos que vayan a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Roman, 58, is a widow, but currently lives with his second partner. He made it through primary school. He lives in his own house and he has two small children who are economically dependent on him. He works in agriculture. He grows potatoes, broad beans, peas, and barley on his land which uses flood irrigation. His fields are in the Minas Pampa community, in the town of Tíraque, approximately 77 kilometers from Cochabamba. Roman and his partner say that they want to continue increasing their agricultural production, and this is why they see the need to apply for funds to invest in chicken manure and certified potato seeds. These are important supplied to get a better harvest and that way get more income to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy chicken manure and potato seeds.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda, de 48 años es una mujer alegre. Vive en compañía de su esposo Wilder, con quien tiene 5 hijos, pero dolo vive con 3 de ellos: Clisver, Yuditza y Roni, a los que cuida en la casa que heredó de su mamá. Junto a su esposo todas las mañanas se dirige a sus terrenos agrícolas donde siembran, habas, cebada, papa y demás productos agrícolas. Ya tiene 25 años de experiencia en la agricultura, lo que más le gusta es poder pasar la mayor parte de sus días en el campo, además de alimentarse de productos naturales. Comenta que gracias al apoyo de su familia pudo obtener terrenos agrícolas propios por esa razón obtiene más ingresos, pues ya no tiene que pagar alquiler. Asimismo se dedica a la crianza de animales entre cerdos, ovejas y vacas de las que obtiene muchos beneficios pues todos los días miércoles y domingos lleva a comercializar los ejemplares a la  feria que se realiza en la ciudad, “gracias a la venta de los animales obtengo un ingreso permanente para mi familia”, afirma. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “mujeres yanamarquinas” y este es el crédito número 2 con MFP, donde se siente desarrollada, ya que obtiene la ayuda económica para progresar en su negocio. Por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Yolanda, invertirá el dinero en la compra de animales, un promedio de 10 ovejas.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 48 years old and is a cheerful woman. She lives with her husband Wilder who cares for their home, which he inherited from his mother. They have 5 children, but only 3 live with them: Clisver, Yuditza, and Roni.

Every morning with her husband she goes to their land where they grow beans, barley, potatoes, and other agricultural products. She has 25 years of experience in agriculture. What she enjoys most is to spend the majority of her days in the field and eating the natural products. She says that thanks to the support of her family, she was able to get her own agricultural land. Because she no longer has to pay rent, she will earn more revenue.

She is also dedicated to raising animals like pigs, sheep, and cows which provide many daily benefits. Wednesdays and Sundays the animals are taken to market in the city. She says, "Thanks to the sale of the animals I get a permanent income for my family."

She belongs to the solidarity group "mujeres yanamarquinas." This is her second loan with MPF. She feels it is well developed since you get economic aid to progress your business. Therefore she promises to be punctual with her payments. Yolanda will invest the money in the purchase of animals, an average of 10 sheep.

loans.use: to buy 10 sheep.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: José tiene 53 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos, vive con su familia actualmente, el solicito un préstamo con el propósito de dar asistencia a su plantación de chile. Este agricultor quiere mantener su producción de chile dulce en las mejores condiciones posibles, para luego llevarlo al mercado y sea factible en su venta, ya que de esta actividad económica dependen el y su familia para salir adelante, el ha demostrado ser un hombre trabajador durante el trascurso de los años según afirman sus vecinos, y esta actitud de superacion lo ha llevado a emprender este gran proyecto, pero debido a que no dispone del dinero necesario para continuar con dicho proyecto hace una solicitud  de  crédito , y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no registra otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en: José is 53 years old. He is married and has two children. He currently lives with his family. He is asking for a loan to assist his chile plantation. This farmer wants to maintain his sweet chile crop in the best possible condition in order to then bring it to the market and sell it profitably, since he and his family depend on this economic activity to move ahead. According to his neighbors, he has demonstrated over the years that he is a hard-working man, and this attitude of self-improvement has brought him to undertake this great project, but due to the fact that he does not have the money necessary to continue with said project he is applying for a loan. This is the first loan that he has received from Fudecosur. He does not have other loans at state banks, but Fudecosur has given him the loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to grow chiles

loans.name: Antonia Del Carmen

texts.es:
La Señora  Antonia se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas desde hace 11 años, desarrolla su actividad en su casa de habitación, sus principales clientes son sus vecinos.
Doña Antonia es muy conocida entre sus vecinos por su amabilidad, su honradez  y por su don de servicio, ella ha sacado varios prestamos con Prisma y ha sido puntual, actualmente desea invertir su préstamo en compras al por mayor de maíz, leña y cal ya que los obtiene mas cómodos y también invertirá parte de su préstamo en compra de suéter, blusas, pantalones y camisetas ya que también se dedica a esta actividad y su deseo de salir adelante la motiva a trabajar duro.
Doña Antonia quiere aprovechar la temporada navideña para incrementar sus ventas ella recibe el apoyo de su esposo y de sus hijos para realizar sus actividades.   
 
Danlí, Honduras - Octubre 2012
texts.en:
Antonia has been making and selling tortillas from her home for 11 years. Her main customers are her neighbours. 

Antonia is well known among her neighbours for her kindness, her honesty and her gift of service. She has taken several loans with Prisma and has been punctual. She now wants to invest her loan in purchasing corn, wood and lime wholesale as its more convenient. Also, she will invest part of the loan in buying sweaters, blouses, pants and shirts; this is also part of her business. Her desire to succeed motivates her to work hard.

Antonia wants to take advantage of the holiday season to boost sales. She receives support from her husband and their children to accomplish these activities.

loans.use: to purchase corn, wood, lime, sweaters, blouses, pants and shirts for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and clean up her land.

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es:
José, vive con su esposa tienen dos hijos, es una persona de hogar, su negocio es la venta de pescado, frijoles y dulces, este negocio lo aprendió desde hace un año y medio, surgió por cuenta propia.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de pescado rojo, blanco, lonjas, frijoles, dulces, que son los que a diario vende a los clientes, con este préstamo lograra mejorar el inventario del negocio, comprándose más mercadería, por el momento sus ventas han mejorado, a través de esta inversión espera aumentar las ganancias.
La aspiración de José es ampliar su negocio, accesar a otras zonas, ofrecer nuevos productos, con la oportunidad de generar mejores ventas.
texts.en:
José lives with his wife and has two children. His wife stays at home and his business is the sale of fish, beans, and sweets. He started this business on his own a year and a half ago.

He is requesting a loan to buy red and white fish, beans, and sweets that are sold to his customers daily. With this loan he will improve his inventory and buy more goods. At the moment sales are improving and through this investment he hopes to increase profits. José aspires to expand his business, access other areas, and offer new products with this opportunity to generate more sales.

loans.use: to buy red and white fish, beans, and sweets.

loans.name: Angel

texts.en:
Angel is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga, in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has two children. For the past two years, Angel has been working hard to manage her business, which is making fresh fruit juices. 

To expand her business, Angel has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. She will use the loan to buy more fruits and to make good juices for resale. The fruits she buys with the loan money will help Angel to generate greater profits. Angel hopes that, in the future, she will be able to buy a car. 

Angel is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and to make good juices for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of his motorcycle.

loans.name: Safina

texts.en:
Safina is married and has two children, and both of them go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent, and feeding the family. 

She has a business selling used clothes, and she has been in this business for five years. She sells to all categories of people, both at retail and wholesale. She doesn’t have any other income-generating activities. Six days a week she goes from door-to-door, selling used clothes.  

Safina has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. Her major business challenges include transportation and thieves. She aspires to own a permanent business premises, to build her own house, and to educate her children up to university.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 20 years old and lives in the town of Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past 2years, Agnes has been working hard to manage her garment store, which vends clothing. 

To help expand her business, Agnes has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more clothes and will help Agnes to generate greater profits and assist her family. Agnes hopes that in the future she will be able to increase the business. 

Agnes is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes

loans.name: 04.5.5 Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hồng has a service business cutting hair. She is requesting a loan to purchase instruments to maintain her barber shop.

Hồng is 32 years old and she is married with 2 children.  She is the group leader of the 04.5.5 Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. Hồng lives with 2 dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Hồng's first loan with the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women.  Hồng has been involved in this business for 5 years.  The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hồng hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase instruments to maintain her barber shop

loans.name: Ghadeer

texts.en: Ghadeer, a 35-year-old conservative woman,  asked her son to take her place in the photo. Ghadeer has four sons and daughters; the oldest is Mohammad, an 18-year-old who is working as an electrician and a mechanic to pay his school fees.  Ghadeer wants to support her son, so she has requested this loan in order to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her son's upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Otamurod

texts.ru: Отамурод проживает в районе Шахритус. Ему 28 лет. Он женат. У него трое детей. На сегодняшний день он вместе с женой занимается посевом сельскохозяйственных культур. Отмурод планирует получить кредит для закупа бычков, чтобы начать свою деятельность. Он хочет заняться животноводством.
texts.en: Otamurod lives in the Shahrituz region. He is 28, married, and has 3 children. He and his wife currently grow agricultural crops. Otamurod plans to take a loan to buy bulls so he can start a new business in animal husbandry.

loans.use: To buy bulls

loans.name: Houn

texts.en:
Houn is 47 years old. She is widowed and resides with five children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been employed as a cleaner for more than three years, earning approximately $3 per day. Additionally, she is involved in breeding pigs to generate more income for the family. Three of her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $16 daily.

In order to improve her family’s finances, Houn is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for her son to run a taxi service. This purchase will help him generate more income for the family.

In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn higher educations. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her son to run a taxi service

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Ms. Naseem is a 54-year-old married woman. Fifteen years ago she began stitching in her house in order to fight poverty.  She stitches for the people living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers.

She is the mother of two and always working hard for the betterment of their family as she needs to provide them a better and prosperous future. With the passage of time, she has improved her business through the support of the Kashf Foundation. She is currently in her 6th loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 20,000 PKR from Kashf. She intends to use this loan amount to buy raw materials including cloth, threads of different colors, laces, zips, etc., to create a means of increasing revenues so she may be able to smoothly meet the needs of her family members.

loans.use: to buy raw materials including cloth, threads of different colors, laces, zips, etc.

loans.name: Mastura

texts.ru: Мастура жительница района Шахритус. Ей 29 лет. Она разведена. У нее двое детей. Она живет вместе с матерью. Мастура одна воспитывает детей. Мать Мастуры занимается растениеводством. Сама Мастура помогает своей матери в ее деятельности. Она хочет заняться своим делом. Мастура берет кредит для закупа мелко - рогатого и крупнорогатого скота, чтобы начать свою деятельность. Она намерена заняться животноводством.
texts.en: Mastura lives in the Shahrituz region. She is 29, divorced, and has 2 children. She lives with her mother, and is raising her children on her own. Her mother grows crops, and Mastura helps her with her work. Mastura wants to start her own business and is seeking a loan to buy cattle and sheep to start a business in animal husbandry.

loans.use: To buy sheep and cows

loans.name: Justina

texts.es: Justina, de 56 años es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía de uno de sus 7 hijos: Yameli a la que cuida en la casa que adquirió de la comunidad hace 20 años. Desde los primero rayos de sol, Justina sale de su casa rumbo a sus terrenos agrícolas que se ubican a una hora de caminata, mientras se dirige a sus sembríos ella lleva consigo a sus animales posee, cerdos y ovejas a las que deja comiendo pastos naturales, mientras ella cuida de sus alimentos, fertilizándolos y quitando la maleza que crece constantemente de entre los surcos. Posee sus propios terrenos agrícolas, gracias a su esfuerzo y alguna herencia de sus padres. Ella gusta de ver como sus alimentos crecen y maduran, ya que de esa manera podrá venderlos en el mercado de la ciudad en temporada de siembra. Ahora desea tener mucho éxito en su próxima siembra de papa orgánica llamada también “nativa”. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “mujeres yanamarquinas” y este es el crédito número 3 con MFP, donde se siente desarrollada, ya que obtiene la ayuda económica para progresar en su negocio. Por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Justina, invertirá el dinero en la compra de abono orgánico para sus próximos sembríos de papa.
texts.en:
Justina, 56, is a modest woman. She lives with one of her seven children; Yameli who takes care of her in the house she obtained in the community 20 years ago. From the first rays of the sun, Justina leaves her home to her farmland located an hour walk away. While she attends the fields, she takes her animals, pigs and sheep, with her to eat natural pasture, while she takes care of the food, fertilizing and removing the weeds which constantly grow between the rows.  She owns her own farmland thanks to her effort and some inheritance from her parents. She likes to see her food grow and ripen because that way she can sell them in the market in the city in planting season. Now she wants to have much success in her next organic potato planting also called “native potatoes”.

She belongs to the support group “yanamarquinas women” and this is loan number 3 with MFP, where she feels developed, as she receives economic aid to progress in her business. She promises to be punctual with her payments. Justina will invest the money to purchase organic fertilizer for her next crop of potatoes.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Odai

texts.en: Odai is 23 years old. He is hard working and currently works for the Civil Defense Department. Because he loves children, Odai enrolled himself in university to study child care. Being one of ten siblings in his family, he has chosen to support himself so that he doesn't increase the financial pressure on his parents. This is the reason that he has applied for this loan to help him pay for his semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for his semester fees

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio es un hombre de 44 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Chincha, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente Julio no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver noticieros en televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Carapulcra con Sopa Seca, la cual es su comida favorita.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, desde hace mas de 5 años, Julio trabaja en su pequeño negocio de soldadura, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor, él puede trabajar un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien por el trato amable y el servicio de calidad que brinda a sus clientes.
Julio se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea poder hacer la refacción, pintado y puesta de instalaciones en la vivienda que vive, de esta manera Julio espera tener un ambiente más seguro y adecuado donde vivir, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr salir adelante y cumplir su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Julio, 44, is single.  He lives in the city of Chincha.  He's a very pleasant, hardworking, and enthusiastic man with a great desire for self-improvement.  Unfortunately Julio wasn't able to study for a profession but he very much would like to have been able to.  In his free time he likes to watch the news on television and sometimes he cooks his favorite dish, a delicious Carapulcra con Sopa Seca [a spicy stew].

On his own initiative and with a lot of effort and dedication, Julio has worked in his own welding business for more than five years.  Every day he starts work very early and can work approximately eight hours.  He believes it's going well for him because of his friendly attitude and the quality service he gives his customers.

Julio is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help he'll be able to make improvements on his house.  He wants to be able to refurbish, paint, and do the installations in the house where he lives.  This way Julio hopes to have a safer and more suitable environment.

He'll continue working and making the effort to manage to get ahead and achieve his big dream of having his own house.

loans.use: to make improvements on his house

loans.name: Alberto Lidifonso

texts.es:
Alberto es un hombre de 37 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por la necesidad de trabajar desde muy joven, Alberto no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta dedicar un poco de tiempo a la lectura y en algunas ocasiones come un riquísimo Ceviche, el cual es su comida favorita.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Alberto trabaja como chofer de taxi, le brinda servicios de transporte, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia sale a recorrer las calles de su ciudad en búsqueda de pasajeros, él puede trabajar un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Alberto se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir sus gastos de médicos de su tratamiento a la vista y podrá comprar los lentes que necesita; de esta manera Alberto espera poder calmar sus dolencias y empezar a mejorar, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para salir adelante cumpliendo sus metas y su sueño de tener su auto propio.
texts.en: Alberto is 37, single, and lives in the city of Ica in the district of Parcona.  He is a very friendly, hard-working, and enthusiastic person.  He has a great desire of getting ahead.  Unfortunately, because of the need to work since he was very young, he couldn't go to college, but he would have liked to very much.  In his free time, he read and sometimes eats delicious ceviche, which is his favorite food.  Through his own initiative and much effort and dedication, he works as a taxi driver, offering transportation services every day.  He starts very early in the morning, covering the streets of his city in search of passengers.  He can work approximately 10 hours, and he thinks things are going well for him because of his friendly service.  Alberto is very thankful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help they have offered him, he will be able to cover the medical costs for his eyes and will be able to buy the glasses that he needs.  He hopes that this will make him feel better and he will start to get better so he can keep working and striving to get ahead, achieving his goals and his dream of having his own car.

loans.use: to cover medical costs.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en: Rehema is married with five children and three of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business selling food such as cassava and sweet potatoes. She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Uganda Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of sweet potatoes and cassava. She has been in this business for 15 years and sells to all categories of people both in retail and wholesale. Her major business challenges include transportation, thieves and seasonality.  She aspires to one day own a delivery van for transportation, to sell only wholesale, and to earn enough profit to buy a plot of land and build her own house. She currently resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bags of sweet potatoes and cassava

loans.name: Bakhtiyor

texts.ru: Бахтиёр проживает в городе Худжанд. Ему 24 года. Он недавно женился. Его жена занимается своим бизнесом. Бахтиёр три года как занимается торговлей. Он арендует торговую точку на рынке, где продает мужскую и женскую одежду. Также у него в продаже имеются банные халаты. Бахтиёр берет кредит для увеличения оборота.
texts.en: Bakhtiyor lives in the city of Khujand. He is 24 years old and recently got married. His wife has her own business. For the past 3 years, Bakhtiyor has been working in retail. He rents a retail space at the market where he sells men's and women's clothing, as well as bathrobes. Bakhtiyor is seeking a loan in order to increase his turnover.

loans.use: To buy menswear

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
Flor de 58 años de edad, originario de Granada, de oficio comerciante, madre de 2 hijos mayores de edad. Ella a la edad de 30 años, inicio su negocio de venta de ropa, al fallecer su mama ella se convirtió en el sostén de su casa. Actualmente se dedica a vender productos variado de ropa.  
Ella solicita el préstamo para poder comprar como blusas, pantalones, faldas y vestidos en todo el mercado ya que sus objetivos es incrementar sus ventas al tener más variedad de ropa sobre todo porque se acerca la época navideña donde  las ventas son muy buenas para el sector comercio. Espera mejorar sus ingresos  y  surtir el negocio con nueva mercadería y variada de productos. Su anhelo es lograr una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Flor is fifty-eight and is from Granada.  She works as a businesswoman and is the mother of two adult children.  At the age of thirty, she started her own clothing business.  When her mother passed away, she became the finacial support of her house.  She currently sells various clothing products.  She is requesting this loan to be able to buy blouses, pants, skirts, and dresses from all over the market.  Her goals are to increase her sales and to have more variety of clothing, above all because the Christmas season is nearing when sales are very good for the commercial sector.  She hopes to increase her income and to stock her business with new merchandise and a variety of products.  Her dream is to achieve a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy blouses, pants, skirts, and dresses.

loans.name: Manuel Isidro

texts.es:
Manuel, vive con su esposa y tres hijos, el es un agricultor, maquinista y molinero, estas actividades las realiza para obtener el dinero que le permita ayudar a su familia, la actividad de maquinista de barco por el momento no la realiza, ya que el barco ha dejado de funcionar, solamente realiza las siembras de maíz, además tiene un molino de nixtamal en el cual presta servicio a la comunidad.
Esta solicitando un préstamo, para utilizarlo en su mayor parte en la compra de un molino nuevo, para instalarlo en otro lugar, otra parte será para abono, herbicidas para el cultivo de maíz y pipian. Este préstamo ayudara a que Manuel tenga la oportunidad de continuar trabajando.
La aspiración de Manuel es construir su vivienda, para tener a su familia mas comoda, aumentar la producción en sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Manuel lives with his wife and three children. 

He is a farmer, machinist and mill operator.  He performs these activities as a way to earn money and help his family.  

At the moment, he does not perform the job of ship machinist because the ship has stopped working.  He only grows corn and lends his services to the community with his “nixtamal” (boiled corn) mill.

Manuel is asking for a loan primarily to buy a new mill and to install it in a different place.  The rest will be used to buy fertilizer and herbicides for his corn and “pipian” (type of squash/pumpkin) crops.  This loan will help give Manuel the opportunity to continue working.

Manuel’s aspirations are to build a home to keep his family comfortable, and to increase the production of his crops.

loans.use: to buy a new mill, fertilizer and herbicides.

loans.name: Nawras

texts.en: Nawras is an eighteen-year-old young man who has a younger brother and sister. He is a university student majoring in Economics. He is applying for this 500 JOD loan from National Microfinance Bank to pay for his upcoming semester’s fees.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester's fees.

loans.name: Celina

texts.es:
La señora Celina  de 33  años de edad,  vive con su esposo y tiene 05 hijos que dependen de ella, vive en casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 03 años al negocio de abarrotería y venta de mariscos. Sus clientes son los vecinos y amigos que a diario le visitan para comprar sus productos. 
Doña Celina vive en una comunidad al sur de de Honduras y solicita el préstamo 10,000.00  lempiras para la compra de camarón, pecado blanco y filete siendo esta su segunda  actividad y sus clientes le están solicitando  este producto.
Doña Celina con el préstamo que se le brinde pretende suplir la necesidad de financiamiento para su negocio y obtener ganancias para mejorar un poco su condición de vida y la de su familia. 
Doña Celina su sueño es tener un buen negocio con mas variedad de productos para obtener ganancias  que le permitan ir mejorando su casa.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - 30 de Octubre  del 2012.
texts.en: Celina is 33 and lives with her husband.  She has 5 children who depend on her.  She lives in her own home and has made a living for 3 years by running a grocery store and seafood-selling business.  Her customers are her neighbors and friends that visit her daily to buy her products.  Doña Celina lives in a community in southern Honduras and is requesting a loan of 10,000 lempiras to buy shrimp, whitefish, and fillets since her customers are requesting these products from her.  She will use the loan that is offered her to supplement her business's financing and to obtain better profits to improve her and her family's living conditions.  Her dream is to have a good business with a greater variety of products to obtain profits that will let her improve her home.

loans.use: to buy shrimp, whitefish, and fillets to improve her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for maintenance on her boat.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is married with three children and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a retail business selling used clothes to all categories of people. She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Uganda Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. Her major business challenges include seasonality and the increasing prices of used clothes in Uganda. She aspires to become a wholesaler and to start importing used clothes. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity but no piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Getchimany

texts.en:
Getchimany is a 30-year-old married woman and the mother of three young children. For more than four years now she has run a sari-sari, or convenience store.

Getchimany is applying for a 12,000 PHP loan from CEVI to buy more stock to sell in her store such as canned goods, noodles, seasonings, detergent and shampoo. She feels that by doing so she will attract and cater to more customers in her store.

Getchimany’s ambition is to expand her business and make it a success. Her desire is to save enough money to pay for her children to attend school.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her store.

loans.name: Rania

texts.en:
Rania, 24, is married and a university student studying to become a school teacher. She is now in her fourth and final year.

Rania is applying for a 300 JOD loan from National Microfinance Bank to pay for her upcoming semester’s fees.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester's fees.

loans.name: Samira

texts.en: Samira, 24 years old and married, established a mini-market to be able to help her husband in supporting their two kids. Now she has applied for this youth loan to obtain more foods and goods for her store to increase her profits.

loans.use: to obtain more foods and goods for her store

loans.name: Diana Mercedes

texts.es: Diana tiene 28 años de edad, casada, tiene dos hijos y vive en el municipio de Olanchito, Yoro. Diana tiene 10 meses de haber decidido por tener su propio negocio en su casa para generar otros ingresos para ayudar al hogar. Vende ropa de segunda mano como pantalones, camisas, camisetas, vestidos, blusas, ropa de niños y otras. Diana quiere invertir en el negocio un préstamo por 15,000 lempiras que solicita actualmente. Con el cual va comprar más ropa usada: comprara un fardo de ropa clasificada y dos de ropa mixta, ya que viene la temporada de fin de año y va fortalecer su inventario y aumentar las ventas. Su meta es mejorar cada día su negocio para sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Diana is 28 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in the municipality of Olanchito, Yoro. Diana decided 10 months ago to have her own home business in order to generate other income for supporting her household. 

She sells second-hand clothing such as pants, shirts, T-shirts, dresses, blouses, children's clothing and other items. The loan for 15,000 lempiras that she is currently applying for, Diana wants to invest in her business. With the loan, she is going to buy more used clothing. 

She will buy a bundle of premium clothing and two of mixed clothing, as the year-end season is coming, and she's going to build up her inventory and increase her sales. 

Her goal is to improve her business each day so that she can help her family get ahead in life.

loans.use: To buy a bundle of premium clothing and two bundles of mixed clothing to sell.

loans.name: Rosa Margarita

texts.es: Rosa de 54 años de edad, originaria  de Granada, de oficio comerciante, madre de 6 hijos todos mayores de edad. Ella inicio  su negocio de venta de comida a la edad de 24 años ha sido su primer y único negocio es una herencia que su mama le dejo ya que ella vendía lo mismo su marido y su hija le ayudan con el negocio. Actualmente ella se dedica a la venta de vigoron  un plato típico de la ciudad. Algunos de sus hijos que viven fuera del país le ayudan atravez de remesas ocasionales. Rosa solicita el préstamo para poder comprar productos como sillas cómodas, paraguas para proteger a los clientes del sol y así poder ofrecer a los clientes comodidad para disfrutar su sabroso vigoron hecho a base de yuca, chicharrón y ensalada de repollo a ella le gustaría tener mas oportunidades de ampliar su negocio por todo el mercado y asi mejorar el local para atraer mas  clientes, sus planes futuros son agrandar su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa is 45 years old, a native of Granada, and a businesswoman by trade. She is the mother of 6 children, all older in age. She started her business selling food at the age of 24; it has been her first and only business. It’s a legacy that her mother left her, as she sold the same thing. Her husband and daughter help her with the business. 

Currently, she works selling vigoron, a typical dish of the city. Some of her children who live outside the country help her by occasionally sending money. 

Rosa is requesting a loan in order to purchase products like comfortable chairs and umbrellas to protect her customers from the sun, and therefore be able to offer her customers comfort to enjoy their tasty vigoron – made from cassava, pork rinds, and cabbage. She would like to have more opportunities to broaden her business throughout the market and therefore improve her business to attract more customers. Her future plans are to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase chairs and umbrellas.

loans.name: Aya

texts.en:
Aya is in her last year of college studying vocational and craft work. Although she is only 21 years old, she established a small beauty salon at home for additional income to support her family; she is one of eight siblings living together at home.

She has applied for this loan to pay her college fees in order to graduate and start concentrating on improving her beauty salon.

loans.use: to pay for her college fees

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en: Aisha, 50 years old and married, is a mother of six sons and daughters. To help support the family with another source of income, she started making embroidered pieces and straw trays. She is applying for this loan in order to obtain more raw materials so she can increase her productivity, therefore increasing her profits.

loans.use: to obtain more raw materials to make embroidered pieces and straw trays

loans.name: 3.14.195.thiệu Khánh Group

texts.en:
Dung operates a food stall/restaurant selling eggs. She is requesting a loan to purchase eggs to resell. Dung has been involved in this business for more than ten years. One of the most critical difficulties facing her business that concerns her is lack of capital.

Dung is 51 years old and is married with three children. Dung supports no dependents with her business in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province, as her children are grown up.

Dung is the group leader of the 3.14.195.Thiệu Khánh solidarity group, which consists of six members.

In 2011, Dung joined the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women to improve her business. Dung has successfully repaid two loans from the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women.

With her business profits, Dung hopes for her business to do well, to build a new house, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase eggs to resell

loans.name: Huda

texts.en: Huda is a 39-year-old mother of five. After her husband's retirement, he started to work as a bus driver while she opened a mini-market next to a school. There, she sells different types of food products, candy and snacks. She has applied for this loan to obtain more of the snacks and candy that the students ask for.

loans.use: to obtain more snacks and candy

loans.name: Riccy Dominga

texts.es: Doña Riccy tiene 59 años de edad, casada, vive en el municipio de Olanchito, Yoro  junto a sus cuatro hijos. Ella ha sido maestra de educación primaria.  Pero hace 10 meses decidió por poner su propio negocio donde fabrica y vende bloques de cemento y arena, también vende grava y arena. Además genera otros ingresos ella tiene dos  volquetas y cobra el  flete por transportar los materiales. Este negocio lo tiene establecido en su casa. Sus clientes son constructores de viviendas en las residenciales privadas quienes le hacen pedidos grandes de bloques, arena y grava. Ella ha decidido solicitar un préstamo a ODEF por 20,000 Lempiras para comprar otra máquina de fabricar bloques, y poder cumplir con la demanda que tiene con sus clientes. Tiene como meta constituir o legalizar el negocio y crecer como una empresa familiar, que haya más estabilidad económica para tener calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Riccy is 59 years old, and married. She lives in the municipality of Olanchito, Yoro with her four children. She has been a primary school teacher, but 10 months ago decided to set up her own business where she makes and sells cement blocks and sand. She also sells gravel. 

She also generates other income. She has two dump trucks and charges delivery for transporting the materials. She has set up this business at her home. Her customers are house builders in new subdivisions, who place large orders for cement blocks, sand and gravel.

She has decided to apply to ODEF for a loan of 20,000 lempiras, in order to buy another machine for making blocks, so that she can meet the demand from her customers. 

Her goal is to incorporate or legalize the business and see it grow as a family company, so that she can have more financial stability and a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a machine for making cement blocks.

loans.name: Juveline

texts.en: Juveline is 23 years old, married and has a two year old daughter. She is from Getafe, Bohol. She has run a sari-sari, or convenience store business for some time now. Juveline works hard to support her husband and to meet the needs of the family. She is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise to sell such as bread, biscuits, canned goods, dry goods, detergents and shampoo. In the future Juveline hopes to expand her business, augment her income, and save money for her daughter's schooling.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell such as bread, biscuits, canned goods, dry goods, detergents and shampoo

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en: Alaa, 22 years old and single, lives with her ten siblings. To help support the family by adding another source of income, she started a clothing sales business, selling mostly women’s clothes, from her home. She is applying for this loan to obtain a new winter collection to increase her profits.

loans.use: to obtain a new winter clothing collection

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase more stock for her son's general store

loans.name: Azra

texts.en:
Azra is a 48-year-old married woman who has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the past year and a half. 

She offers various goods of daily use such as cleansing products and grocery items. She knows the art of retaining customers and enjoys dealing with them.

Her husband is employed in a small garment shop, but his income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family alone. Azra contributes a lot to the family income.

Azra is a mother of five children and is motivated to provide for her family. She is working hard to cover educational expenditures and other household expenses. Currently she has requested a loan of Rs. 25,000 to fully stock her store with the purchase of grocery items like rice, sugar and flour. This will enable her to cater to more customers time after time, which will ultimately improve her earnings.

She wishes to use part of the revenue for personal expenses and to increase her business capital.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items like rice, sugar and flour in bulk.

loans.name: Mary Group

texts.en:
This is Mary Group. It has seven members who are engaged in selling such goods as maize, fish, sugar, plastic products, rice and flour. All are from Teshie, a coastal township outside Accra.

Mary, 58, is the group’s leader. She lives with her four children, who help Mary in her business selling maize. She has worked from home seven days a week for the past ten years. She buys her maize in the Brong Ahafo region in central Ghana and other supplies in Accra. She sells the maize to thirty customers in Teshie alone and ten customers from nearby towns.

Mary last took a 1,200 GHS loan with ID Ghana and invested it in her maize business. She repaid it without difficulty. This will be Mary’s fifth loan with ID Ghana. As leader of the group she is applying for a 5,250 GHS loan that will be apportioned among her group’s members.

Mary will use her 1,700 GHS portion of the loan to buy twenty bags of maize and other supplies. She is well placed to use this loan judiciously.

One of Mary’s goals is to own a maize depot so she can supply more customers. By doing so she will increase her income and so improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy twenty bags of maize and other supplies.

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es: El Sr. Humberto  tiene 52 años es casado con 2 hijos que son de las edades de 12 y 16 años, el se dedica al comercio minorista,  el tiene la  venta de juguetes su puesto se encuentra en la una de las ferias más populosas de la ciudad de Santa cruz zona, este préstamo es el  primero que ha tomado con la institución, el Sr. Humberto va a usar este préstamo para la compra de mercadería, como juguetes al por mayor ya que se acercan las fiestas de fin de año y es estas fechas tiene mucha demanda y de esta manera incrementar su capital de trabajo,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es compra de mercadería para surtir su puesto, el Sr. Humberto  enfrenta retos en su negocio que es la demanda que hay de nuevos productos y va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de variedad de producto y sueña con ampliar su casa y su negocio, el Sr. Humberto se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Humberto is 52 years old and married with 2 children, who are ages 12 and 16 years. He works in the retail business he has selling toys. His place is located in one of the most populous markets in the city of Santa Cruz zone. 

This loan is the first that he has taken out with the organization. Humberto is going to use this loan for the purchase of merchandise, such as toys in bulk, since the year-end parties are coming up, and on these dates he has a lot of demand. His reason for requesting this loan is to purchase merchandise to supply his stall.

Humberto confronts challenges in his business, one of which is the demand for new products. He is going to use the profits for the purchase of a variety of products, and he dreams of expanding his house and his business. Humberto feels happy and grateful to the organization for the support given in the granting of the loan.

loans.use: to purchase toys in bulk.

loans.name: Lubna

texts.en:
Lubna, 41 years old, is a married lady and a mother of three kids. She established a small beauty salon at her home to add a supporting source of income to her family.

She applied for this loan in order to buy new tools for her salon, such as hair brushes and a hair dryer, to improve her services.

loans.use: to buy new tools for her salon, such as hair brushes and a hair dryer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more bamboo and pay employees for making cue sticks.

loans.name: Los Consentidos Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento LOS CONSENTIDOS está  compuesto por Nueve integrantes seis mujeres, y tres  varones, la presidenta del  banco es la Sra. Fidelia, tiene 29 años y cuatro hijos de las edades de 2, 5, 9 y 15 años, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas de temporada, en esta época se encuentra vendiendo plátano, pero ya llega la cosecha de mangos, fruta que compra directo del productor, en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de frutas según la temporada, la Sra. Fidelia enfrenta retos en su negocio que son salir de la pobreza y  va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar su calidad de vida y la  de su familia su  sueño para su negocio es ser una de las mejores comerciantes y crecer en su negocio para así generar más ingresos se siente feliz y agradecida con la  institución por el apoyo brindado a ella y a sus compañeras que en muchos casos mantiene  solas a su familias.
texts.en:
Los Consentidos Communal Bank is made up of nine members, six women and three men.  The president of the bank is Fidelia.  She's 29 years old and has four children, ages 2, 5, 9, and 15.  She makes a living selling seasonal fruit.  This season she's selling bananas but the mango harvest is coming; she buys it directly from the grower.

She's requesting this loan to buy seasonal fruit.

Fidelia faces challenges in her business such as getting out of poverty.  She's going to use the profits to improve her quality of life and her family's.  Her dream for her business is to be one of the best merchants and to grow in her business to generate more income.

She feels happy and is grateful to the institution for their support of her and her colleagues who in many cases support their families alone.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruit

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is married with six children, only two of whom go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She resides in her own house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses are school fees and feeding the family.

Margaret has a business selling used clothes and has been in this business for eight years. She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings from Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO (MCDT SACCO) to buy more bundles of used clothes.

She works at the market six days a week and sells on retail basis only. She sells piped water to generate additional income. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She aspires to buy a delivery van to lessen these challenges.

loans.use: To buy more bundles of used clothes

loans.name: Raymund

texts.en:
Most parents wish to send their children to school to earn a degree and obtain employment quickly thereafter. They believe that education is the best treasure they can give to their children. Raymund is a parent who wishes to give that treasure to his children. 

Raymund is 27 years of age and has one kid. It is too early for him to think of his child’s education, but he is preparing for his child’s future. Raymund admits that he did not enter higher education; his only way to attain his wish is planting rice and taking care of hogs. Raymund recently began his hog raising business and is in the process of growing the business. 

Raymund is requesting a loan of P45,000 to buy piglets and feed for maintenance. He is hoping for continued growth of his business in order to make his wish a reality.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Abeer

texts.en: Abeer is married and 30 years old.  She rented a shop and turned it into a beauty salon that is helping to pay some of the household bills.  Now she has applied to this youth loan in order to get more tools and equipment that would improve and add more services to the salon.

loans.use: to buy more tools and equipment for hair care.

loans.name: Marthan

texts.en:
Marthan is a 48-year-old married woman.  She has been in the business of making brooms for the past 15 years.  She lives in a small house in Gujranwala and sells her brooms in the local market.  Her husband’s income was barely enough to meet the growing needs of the family.  Initially sales were low and retailers were reluctant to keep them in their store.  But over time, with hard work and dedication, Marthan mastered the art of broom making.  

She is currently in her 2nd loan cycle.  Due to an increase in demand for brooms, she applied for another loan in the amount of 30,000 PKR.  She intends to purchase a large quantity of raw material (broomcom and wooden handles) since she can now produce a lot more than before.  This will enable her to increase her supply to more cities and to gain more profits.

loans.use: to purchase raw material for making brooms (bundles of broomcom, wooden handles).

loans.name: Marisa

texts.en: Marisa is a 32-year-old married woman and a mother of five children from Talibon, Bohol.  She is in the business of selling soft drinks and other beverages.  This is the source of her income.  Marisa works hard to support her husband in order to meet the needs of her family.  She plans to expand her business but lacks the financial resources to do so.  She is now requesting a loan to buy more beverages to sell in her store (such as liquors and soda).  In the future, Marisa hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more beverages for resale in her store (soda, liquors).

loans.name: Nazma

texts.en: Ms. Nazma is a 25-year-old married woman. She got married at an early age and faced many problems running her house. Three years ago, she initiated a business of making paper envelopes to support her family. She has four children and is eager to give them a beautiful life with a good education, food and clothing. By establishing good relations with a wholesaler, she has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of her family. She has requested a loan of Rs 20,000 to buy bundles of paper at lower rates from the market. She hopes to increase sales and desires to use the profits she earns on her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy paper for her envelope making business

loans.name: Abdou

texts.fr:
