Né en 1957 à Mopti, Monsieur Abdou est marié et réside dans une famille traditionnelle avec son frère et autres parents à Heremakono Nord, un des  quartiers de la ville de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Abdou n’ayant pas eu la chance de progresser dans les études, s’est initié à cette activité d’achat et de vente de radios, de radios-cassettes, de cassettes, de lunettes, etc il y a environ 20 ans. Son activité est menée au grand marché de Bougouni avec une clientèle composée de toutes les couches sociales et surtout de forains. Il est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, Il décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Après un premier prêt qui fut correctement remboursé, il sollicite son deuxième crédit pour acheter à Bamako,  20 radios, 4 cartons de cassettes. 
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born in 1957 in Mopti, Mr. Abdou is married and lives in a traditional family with his brother and other parents in Heremakono Nord, one of the districts in the city of Bougouni (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Abdou did not have a chance to pursue much education. About twenty years ago, he got introduced to the business of buying and selling radios, radio-cassettes, tapes, etc. His business is conducted at the general market in Bougouni. His clientele is composed from all social classes, with a majority of fairground workers. He is very much in demand from his clients due to the quality of his products.

In order to better satisfy his still-growing clientele, he decided to join micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. After a first loan which was duly repaid, he is now requesting a second loan to purchase twenty radios and four boxes of tapes in Bamako.

With this loan, he is expecting to make a monthly profit of 100,000 FCFA to be used to contribute to the family’s expenses, to pay back the loan and its interests, with the remainder to be reinvested in his business.

loans.use: to buy radios and tapes.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.en:
Pablo is 47 years old and has four children who are in school.  Through farming he sustains his family necessities but admits that it gets difficult to pay for school fees.  Hence, he is willing to have an additional income source besides farming.

So Pablo extends his farming business into livestock even though he does not have enough capital to maintain it.  Pablo wanted to borrow a loan of 34,000 PHP to buy piglets, feed, and vaccines.  He will use the loan wisely for the improvement and growth of his business.  He hopes to increase his profit and to pay for the school fees of his children.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed, and vaccines.

loans.name: Binta

texts.fr:
Née vers 1982 à Bougouni, Bitta est une célibataire et mère d’un enfant qui vit chez son père dans le quartier Heremakono Nord de Bougouni.   
Binta mène cette activité d’achat et de vente de tissus Burkinabé et des vêtements “friperie” il y a environ cinq ans. Elle jouit d’une forte réputation dans cette activité et reçoit beaucoup de commande surtout à l’approche de fêtes et en saison froide. Ainsi, elle décida d’adhérer au programme de Soro Yiriwaso avec lequel elle est à son 2 ème prêt individuel, le premier prêt précédent a été correctement remboursé. Elle compte acheter avec ce 2 ème prêt  2 colis de vêtements Burkinabé auprès des voyageurs. Elle les revendra de façon ambulante à une clientèle composée généralement des chefs de famille de sa localité.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 50 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born around 1982 in Bougouni, Binta is single. She has one child, who lives with the father in the district of Heremakono Nord, in Bougouni.

Binta has been in the business of buying and selling clothing from Burkina Faso and second-hand clothing for about five years. She enjoys a great reputation in the business and gets many orders, especially before the holidays and in the cold season. She thus decided to join Soro Yiriwaso’s program. She is on her second individual loan with the organization, after having duly repaid the previous loan. With this second loan, she is planning on purchasing two lots of Burkinabe clothing from itinerant sellers. She will then resell them door-to-door, to a clientele mostly composed of the town’s household heads.

With this loan, she expects to make a monthly benefit of 50,000 FCFA. It will mostly be reinvested to contribute to the family’s expenses and to repay her loan and its interests, with the remainder to be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Eunice Group

texts.en:
Eunice is a happy and hardworking 31-year-old woman. She is married to a 35-year-old driver and they have 3 children. Eunice belongs to the 2-member group called "Eunice". She says, "Thanks to ID Ghana for bringing in Kiva. Through the help of ID Ghana, our businesses have improved because we have capital to invest into work. In this way we can pay off the loan and also improve conditions for our families." 

Eunice has been selling second-hand clothing for 12 years now. She started selling napkins, but after her third loan she gathered enough capital to go fully into the second-hand clothing business. She started selling in the township and later moved to markets in the community to transact business. 

This is Eunice’s fifth loan and she is requesting 400 GHS to buy 1 bale of ladies’ wear to supply her customers. The other member of this group, Joana, will buy more flask and wine glasses.

Together, they need a total amount of 700 GHS to buy more stock.

loans.use: to buy second-hand women's clothes to sell

loans.name: Maash

texts.en: Maash is a 39-year-old married woman and mother of 7 sons and daughters.  Her husband works at a gas station to support his big family.  In order to help her husband, Maash opened a mini market to sell various food products and snacks.  She now applied for a loan that will help her to bring more types of food goods to increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy more food items for her market.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 33 years old. She is married and has six children between the ages of three and 15. She sells rice and potatoes. With the loan, she wants to buy additional rice and potatoes. With the profits, she will add more product.

loans.use: to buy more rice and potatoes to sell

loans.name: Felecien

texts.en: Felecien is 34 years old. He sells clothes. He has been in the business for the past 14 years. With the loan, he wants to add new new styles of clothes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to renovate his house.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Flor Elisa

texts.es:
En el Municipio de Santa Rosa del Peñón una preciosa ciudad dedicada en sus actividades comerciales ubicada en el departamento de León, la joven Flor Elisa es conocida como una persona responsable, dedicada a trabajo y además de todo es honesta.

Es casada cuenta con un hijo bajo su cargo y sus principales  funciones es desempeñar el cargo de enfermera en uno de los Centros.

Flor mantiene a su familia y asegura que su único hijo valla a la escuela con mucha necesidad. 

De momento solo cuenta con su buena salud, su capacidad de trabajo, su pequeña vivienda que la ha ido construyendo con créditos que le ha financiado Kiva y Ceprodel debido a que en el crédito pasado se le financio para esta misma actividad, hoy en día solicita a kiva y Ceprodel que le financien un crédito para la compra de 90 metros de cerámica y poderlo pagar con cuotas mensuales a un plazo de 13 meses, con lo poco que ella gana no se ajusta para realizar una sola inversión por tal razón solicita este tipo de crédito.
texts.en:
In the Municipality of Santa Rosa del Peñón, a charming city dedicated to its commercial activities and located in the department of León, the young woman Flor Elisa is known as a responsible person, dedicated to her work and above all honest.

She is married and has one child in her care; her main work is holding the position of a nurse in one of the Centers.

Flor supports her family and assures that her only child goes to school, even with so much need.

At this time, she only counts on her good health, her ability to work, and her small home that she has been constructing with loans that Kiva and Ceprodel have funded her for this work. Currently, she is requesting that Kiva and Ceprodel finance her a loan for the purchase of 90 meters of tile, and also that she be able to pay with monthly installments to a term of 13 months.  With the little that she earns, she can’t adjust to completing a single loan; for this reason, she is requesting this type of loan.

loans.use: to purchase tiles.

loans.name: Jameelah

texts.en: Jameelah is a 48-year-old mother of seven sons and daughters. She has a small clothing sales business at home that helps in paying the household bills sometimes. Recently, Jameelah has started to be known amongst her neighbors and friends. She has applied for this loan to bring in a new winter collection in order to increase her profits in hopes that one day she can have her own clothing store.

loans.use: to buy a new winter collection of clothes to resell

loans.name: Victoriana

texts.en:
Victoriana is a 59-year-old married woman from Baclayon, Bohol. She has four adult children. She has been in the sari-sari (variety) store business for 10 years. She sells commodities like canned goods, soap, noodles and toiletries. 

She requested a loan of 30,000 Philippines pesos to have additional capital to purchase more merchandise to sell, like canned goods, soap, toiletries, sugar, vinegar and soy sauce. 

In the future, Victoriana would like to expand her business in order to construct a huge and spacious grocery store, and at the same time, alleviate her family's financial status.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like canned goods, soap, noodles and toiletries.

loans.name: Misbah

texts.en: Ms. Misbah is a 36-year-old married woman who helps her husband in running a general store in their home. They want to increase their inventory as the population of their neighborhood has increased in recent years. When the couple started their relationship with Kashf their store was small and had very few items. Over the last two years, they have been injecting the store with new items and it has become popular in the community. Currently, Misbah has applied for a loan of Rs 20,000 to add new racks to the store to increase storage capacity and buy more packs of beverages. She has five children who are studying in different classes. The family is living a much better life than before because they are able to meet their expenses easily and maintain a good standard of living.

loans.use: to add new racks to her store to increase storage capacity and buy more packs of beverages

loans.name: Natia

texts.en:
Natia is from the Sagarejo district of East Georgia. She is 40 years old, divorced and lives with her two children (22 and 12 years old). The elder daughter is a student and the younger son goes to the local school. The family earns their living through their agricultural business. In particular, Natia runs a small dairy farm and produces dairy products which are sold locally. In addition, the family owns a greenhouse in which tarragons are grown. Natia does all relevant agricultural works to ensure a good harvest. The harvested products are sold to greens wholesalers.

Natia requested a loan to purchase a greenhouse polyethylene cover to allow her to sow more tarragon. After the greenhouse is covered properly, it will keep the needed temperature and the family will be able to harvest and sell tarragon during the whole year. This will significantly increase the family's income which Natia will use for improving the living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a polyethylene cover for her greenhouse

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina started raising hogs in 2009. She began this business at a very young age to help her parents to generate funds for their family's basic commodities. Rosalina just finished high school. Although she didn't enter college, she is still able to manage her business through the help of her parents. 

Rosalina would like to take out a loan of PHP30,000 to buy feed and vitamins for her hogs and to buy supplies to maintain her farm plot. She knows that through this loan she could ensure the proper growth of her hogs. In addition, she could help her parents in preparing the farm plot and buying some farm supplies. Rosalina assures that she can obtain greater profit due to her hard labor and adaptation of new techniques in raising healthy hogs and producing corn crops.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her hogs and to buy supplies to maintain her corn field

loans.name: Jaymar

texts.en:
Jaymar didn't finish his studies. Instead, he focused on running his livestock and farming business. He is now 32 years old, married and has been blessed with two children. Jaymar has been through a lot of difficulties in life, and he doesn't want to let his children experience what he has gone through. He has worked with great perseverance and patience to run his business, and has been able to grow his profit. 

Jaymar isn't satisfied with the success that he has had so far.  He used a previous loan to generate increased profits, which he used to cover some household expenses and invest in his business.  Now he would like to get a new loan of 36,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP), to buy sacks of hog feed and vitamins. He expects that this new loan will help him achieve his goals for his family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of hog feed and vitamins to help raise his hogs

loans.name: Shabina

texts.en:
Ms Shabina is a 35-year-old married woman. She stitches clothing for ladies in her community and manages to contribute to her household income. She belongs to a poor family as her husband is a rickshaw driver who can barely meet the needs of his wife and four children. With her earnings she is sending three of her children to school. However, when Kashf’s officer met her for the first time Shabina was in a challenging phase of her life. Her husband was frustrated with the growing household expenses and none of her children were going to school. With her loan she bought a new stitching machine and started working as a tailor. Shabina has been our client for about two years now and has been able to turn around her life with her dedication to work and Kashf’s support. 

In the future she plans to take orders from a local boutique and will try to become a permanent supplier to them. For this she has applied for a loan of Rs. 30,000 to purchase one more sewing machine for her daughter to assist her in completing orders. She also requires purchasing raw material such as reels of threads and packs of buttons in different colors. She expects a boost in her earnings which she will use for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase one more sewing machine and raw materials such as reels of threads and packs of buttons in different colors

loans.name: Number 15 Group

texts.en:
This group is called ‘Number 15’ and it is made up of eight women. One of them is Christiana, who was born at Teshie and is thirty-nine years old. She is married to a 45-year-old mechanic, and they have three children. Christiana has completed secondary school, after which she decided to go into trading. She wants to work in order to help her husband with the household expenses.  
 
Christiana sells chickens and rice from door to door. She has been doing this for 19 years, and it is going well. Her earnings have grown, so she has been able to buy more chicken and rice to meet her customers' demand. 

This is Christiana's 3rd loan cycle, and she needs 300 Ghana cedis (GHC) to buy more rice and chicken meats. The other members of the group include Josephine, who would like to buy milo, milk and sugar, Emelia who sells fish and Rebecca who sells cooking utensils.  The group also includes Mary, who sells charcoal, Diana selling yams, Rebecca selling fish and Paulina selling plates. They need a total amount of GHC 3,250 to buy enough commodities for their customers.

loans.use: To buy chickens and rice to sell to customers.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana, de 44 años es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía de su esposo e hijos en la casa que heredó de sus padres hace muchos años. Su vida siempre ha estado en continuo contacto y trabajo de campo, ya que sus padres y su abuelita le enseñaron desde muy pequeña. Las actividades agrícolas y la crianza de animales siempre han sido parte de su vida, más aun que su trabajo y esfuerzo se despliega en beneficio de sus hijos que están en su poder y sostiene la educación de cada uno de ellos.
Ana cada día se dedica a la crianza de vacas y toros, ella los compra cuando aun están tiernos y luego los engorda para venderlos, también  alimenta bien a sus vacas para poder luego preñarlas y en época de lactancia poder extraer la leche y venderlas es por ello que ha habilitado en su casa un establo para sus vacas y toros, ella los cría con tanta dedicación y cariño que les pone nombre a cada uno de ellos. Su mayor deseo es hacer una pequeña planta lechera para lo cual esta preparándose y capacitándose. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Manos fuertes” y este es el crédito número 14 con MFP, donde se siente desarrollada, ya que obtiene la ayuda económica para progresar en su negocio. Por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Ana, invertirá el dinero en la compra de comida balanceada para alimentar a sus animales.
texts.en:
Ana, 44, is a simple woman. She lives with her ​​husband and children in the house she inherited from her parents many years ago. Her life has always been in constant contact with field work, as her parents and her grandmother taught her since she was a small child. 

Farming and animal husbandry have always been a part of her life, even more so as her work and effort are for the benefit of her children who are dependent on her. She supports each one's education.

Ana dedicates every day to raising cows and bulls. She buys them when they are young and then fattens them up to sell. She also feeds her cows well so that she can later breed them, and during the lactation period, milk them and sell them. For this she has built a stable at her house for her cows and bulls; she raises them with such dedication and love that she gives each one a name. 

Her greatest desire is to build a small dairy for which she is preparing and training herself. She belongs to the group Manos Fuertes (Strong Hands). This is her 14th loan with MFP, where she feels like she is developing, now that she has obtained economic aid to grow her business. She promises to be timely with her payments. Ana will invest the money in buying balanced meal to feed her animals.

loans.use: to buy balanced meal for her animals.

loans.name: Ekaterine

texts.en: Ekaterine is 34 years old. She lives in Sagarejo, Kakheti region, East Georgia, with her parents and brother. Her mother is a librarian, her father is a watchman and her brother works as a security guard. They all get a monthly income. The family is involved in the animal husbandry business. They have two milk cows, whose milk is used in cheese production, and 2 calves. Ekaterine sells cheese in an open market locally at a good price. She is a very hardworking woman and has a rich experience in her business. Ekaterine requested a loan to purchase building materials for renovation of the shed. The existing shed is too small and won't allow her to implement her future plans. She wants to purchase additional livestock in the near future and keep them in the renovated cattle-shed. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase building materials for the shed

loans.name: Guillermo Antonio

texts.es:
Guillermo de 41 años de edad, originario de Granada, de oficio comerciante, padre de 2 hijos mayores de edad. El inicio de ayudante de su cuñada que vendía arena y le ayudaba con el acarreo, luego el decidió poner su propio negocio el cual comenzó a los 34 años comprando al crédito gaseosa y asi fue incrementando sus ventas y ganancias. Actualmente el se dedica a la venta de sodas, gaseosas y jugos.
Guillermo solicita el préstamo para poder comprar más bebidas como gaseosa, jugo, etc. Ya que este crédito  le ayudaría a comprar más producto, además obtener mayores ganancias, su meta es hacer crecer su negocio y convertirlo en una fuente de ingresos sostenible.
texts.en:
Guillermo is a 41 years old merchant from Granada with two grown children. He started as an assistant for his sister-in-law who sells sand. He would help her with transportation. He then decided to start his own business which he began at age 34, buying soda which increased his sales and profits. Currently, he sells soft drinks and juice. 

Guillermo is requesting this loan to be able to buy more drinks such as soda, juice, etc. This loan will help him buy more products. In addition to more income, his goal is to grow his business and turn it into a sustainable source of income.

loans.use: to buy more drinks such as soda, juice, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La señora Gregoria  de 42 años de edad,  vive con su Esposo y tiene 03 hijos que dependen de ella, vive en casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 02 años al negocio de venta de tortillas, sus clientes le prefieren por su buena atención y la limpieza de su cocina.
Doña Gregoria vive al sur de Honduras y esta solicitando 10,000.00 lempiras para la compra de maíz, leña y cal. ya que quiere almacenar bastante maíz para tener materia prima durante un buen tiempo, ya que tiene gran demanda de este  producto.
Doña Gregoria con el préstamo ella pretende suplir la necesidad de financiamiento para su negocio y de esta manera tener ganancias y mejorar un poco su condición de vida y la de sus hijos. 
El sueño de Gregoria  es en un futuro poder repellar  su casa
texts.en:
Gregoria, 42, lives with her husband and has 3 children that depend on her. She lives in her own home and she has made her living selling tortillas for two years. Her clients prefer her because of the customer attention and clean kitchen. 

Gregoria lives in the south of Honduras and is requesting HNL 10,000 to buy more corn, wood, and lime. She wants to have plenty of corn to store for a long time as it is in high demand.

With this loan, Gregoria will meet the financing needs for her business, increase her income, and improve her quality of life and that of her children.

Gregoria’s dream is to be able to plaster her home in the future.

loans.use: to buy corn, wood, and lime for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To maintain his yautia (edible plant) plantation.

loans.name: Denis Alberto

texts.es:
En el Municipio de Achuapa una Bella y encantadora ciudad, conocida como tierra de Achote donde se practican diferentes culturas Nicaragüenses, como es el baile del folklore, esto está ubicada en el departamento de león, es donde habita el Señor Denis Alberto.

Es casado cuenta con cuatro hijo bajo su cargo y sus principales  funciones es desempeñar el cargo de director de educación primaria.

 Denis mantiene a su familia y asegura que su hijo valla a la universidad con mucha necesidad ya que su núcleo familiar se compone de 6 persona, habita en una casita con malas condiciones, con lo poco que el gana ni siquiera puede construir un pequeño cuarto que le ayudara a mantener en mejores a su familia, por lo que solicita un financiamiento para la compra de cemento, Arena, Zin y pago de mano de obra, él ha descubierto que en su pequeña vivienda están necesitando de construir un anexo ya que la única esperanza con que él cuenta es que Kiva y Ceprodel le puede dar este tipo de financiamiento.
texts.en:
In the beautiful, enchanting city of Achuapa, known as the land of Achote, there are different Nicaraguan cultural activities, including folk dancing.  This is in the department of León, where Denis Alberto lives.  He is married and has four children in his care.  He works as an elementary school principal.

Denis supports his family and wants to make sure his son goes to the university, which is difficult with six members in the family.  He lives in a small house in poor conditions, and is unable to afford to build even a small room to make his family more comfortable.  Therefore, he is requesting a loan to buy cement, sand, and corrugated metal, as well as hire workers.  He realizes his small dwelling is in need of more space; and his only hope is receiving support from Kiva and Ceprodel who can provide the type of financing he needs.

loans.use: To buy cement, sand, corrugated metal, and hire workers.

loans.name: Tsitsino

texts.en:
Tsitsino is from the village of Patardzeuli of Kakheti region. She is 58 years old, and lives with her husband, daughter, son and daughter-in-law. Tsitsino’s daughter works as a teacher at the local school. Her son and daughter-in-law are also employed by a private company. All of them get a monthly income. Tsitsino is running a small dairy farm. She produces yogurt with the received milk and sells it in supermarkets in the capital city. She is a very hard-working woman, with a rich experience in her work. 

With this loan, she will purchase hay, which will be used for feeding the cows during the fall and winter seasons. Since the cattle will be fed properly in winter, Tsitsino will be able to receive a planned amount of milk and produce dairy products. This will increase the income of the family. With the increased income, Tsitsino will expand her dairy business and purchase additional cows to receive more milk. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase hay for feeding the cattle.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en:
Jeanne is 32 years old. She owns a hairdressing salon. She has been running the business for four years. She wants the loan to buy more shampoos and hairdressing tools. 

The profits from the business will be used to buy her own house which will be used in the business as a hair salon.

loans.use: To buy more shampoos and hairdressing needs.

loans.name: Clemantine

texts.en: Clemantine is 34 years old. She sells clothes and has another business selling spare parts. She wants the loan to buy more spare parts for sale. The profits from the business will be used to buy a house.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Cotilda

texts.en:
Cotilda is married with four children; two of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She has a business of selling charcoal and has been in this charcoal business for four years. She works six days out of every week at the market. 

She has applied for loan of 800,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. Her major challenges include school fees, and feeding the family. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en: Claudine is 24 years old. She is married and they both have four children. The loan will be used to buy beans and bananas for sale. She plans to make savings from the profits from the business.

loans.use: To buy more bananas for sale.

loans.name: Tasleem

texts.en:
Ms Tasleem is a 32-year-old married woman.  She has been in the business of milk sales for the past 15 years. She is a symbol of determination. She has three children and two are school-going. She believes in education of her children so she started sending them to school from an early age. She is earning PKR 8,000 per month from her business. She is very happy that she can avail herself of the facility of micro-finance which has helped her establish her business and now she has come very far. 

She has two buffaloes who provide milk and their supply of milk has grown, but she doesn't want to loose potential customers. Now she wants to purchase one more buffalo to increase milk sales to earn more profit. For this purpose she has applied for a loan of PKR 20,000 from Kashf which will be used with her savings to buy another buffalo.  She desires to provide a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: To purchase one more buffalo.

loans.name: 30 De Octubre Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “30 DE OCTUBRE”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Hilda es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: costura de faldas, venta de salteñas, tienda de barrio, venta de fruta y ayudante de albañil, venta de pescado, venta de celulares.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Hilda es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de costura; cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió hace años aprendiendo de un anterior trabajo donde elaboraba este tipo de productos.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de telas) que adquirirá de las empresas distribuidoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank "30 DE OCTUBRE" is beginning its first loan cycle in the Pro Mujer program sponsored by the Panamerican Social Center.  The group is comprised of six members and the acting president is Hilda.  The members are involved in different business activities including dress-making, meat pie sales, convenience store, fruit sales, bricklayer assistance, fish sales and cell phone sales.

The loan they are requesting will benefit small entrepreneurs, incluiding Hilda who has been in the Pro Mujer Program for a year.  She joined by invitation from one of the institution's promoters.  She currently works as a seamstress and says she started the business years ago and learned her trade at a previous job where she made all kinds of products.

She plans to use the loan to increase her working capital and buy fabrics from one of the distributors in the city of El Alto.  Then she will make her products to sell at her stall.  Her work allows her to generate income to support her household as best she can since she is single and has a son.

When asked what she enjoys about Pro Mujer, she says she likes the health training area.

loans.use: To buy fabric.

loans.name: Mercedes De Jesús

texts.es:
En el Municipio de Santa Rosa del Peñón una bella ciudad dedicada en diferentes actividades comerciales ubicada en el departamento de León, la joven Mercede De Jesús es conocida como una persona dedicada a trabajo.
Mercedes necesita un financiamiento de Kiva y Ceprodel para pagarlo a un plazo de 14 meses donde lo invertirá en la compra de Madera, Zin, para la mejorar el techo de su vivienda, ya que las fuertes Lluvias que ha enfrentado en la temporada le han ocasionado mucho daño a su vivienda.

Es madre soltera con dos hijos bajo su cargo donde trabaja en un centro de salud, con lo poco que ella recibe de su sueldo desea mejorar su vivienda, por tal razón le pide a kiva y Ceprodel, con tanto deseos de mejorar el rendimiento de sus ingresos que le financien este crédito.  

De manera, solo cuenta con su honestidad, su buen record crediticio, su buena salud y su dedicación al trabajo, esto la hace a que pueda pagar el crédito al plazo solicitado. 

"Con toda seguridad Agradezco a Dios como primer instancia por haberla dirigido Ceprodel y Kiva, para que estos me sigan dando más crédito para el desarrollo y condiciones de mi familia"
texts.en:
In the beautiful city of Santa Rosa del Peñón, in the department of León, there are many different commercial activities.  Mercedes de Jesús is a young woman who is known for her dedication to work.

Mercedes is in need of a loan from Kiva and Ceptrodel, which she will pay back over a 14-month period.  She plans to buy wood and corrugated metal to repair the roof of her house, since the harsh seasonal rain has caused much damage to her dwelling.

She is a single mother of two children and works at the health center.  Her salary cannot be stretched to cover household improvement, so she is requesting a loan from Kiva and Ceprodel so she can put her income to better use.

For the time being all she has is her honesty, good credit record, good health and dedication to work.  This will allow her to pay back the loan on time.

"First of all, I want to thank God for having sent me to Ceprodel and Kiva, who I hope will continue giving me loans so I can improve my family's living conditions."

loans.use: To buy corrugated metal and wood.

loans.name: Maqsood

texts.en:
Ms Maqsood is a 53-year-old married woman and a mother of two. She started her business of milk sales three years ago. She is wise enough to realize that inflation is high and a time will come when she will need extra cash to meet the daily demands of her family. So keeping this in mind, she bought her first buffalo three years ago. Her business flourished and she made her name in the community. 

Now she wants to purchase one more cow to increase her monthly profit by her bigger sales. Therefore she applied for loan of PKR 20,000 from Kashf Foundation. She wishes to use a part of her profits on the improvement of her house.

loans.use: To purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Jenneh

texts.en:
Jenneh, 36, lives at Airport. She is a single parent with a child that is fifteen years old, and is currently in school. For the past nine years, she has been involved in a business where she sells plates, glasses, cups, rubber bowls, spoons and pitchers at the community market. Because of the good interaction with her customers, she makes a profit every day. With the profit she buys more goods, and attends to the needs of her child. 

She is requesting a loan to purchases more rubber bowls, spoons,  pitchers and plates in order to increase her sales. Her plan for the future is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchases more rubber bowls, spoons, pitchers and plates to increase her sales.

loans.name: Luba

texts.en:
Luba is 51 years old, and is from a small village of Sagarejo district, Kakheti region, East Georgia. She lives with her husband, son, daughter-in-law and two infant grandchildren. Her husband works as a smith and gets a monthly income. The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have a milk cow, whose milk is used in cheese production. Ekaterine owns a plot of land, where she has planted 40 nut-trees. In addition, they have two horses, which are used for taking the wood from the forest by her husband and son. Each member of the family works hard and has rich experience in their business. 

Luba requested a loan to purchase a car. After purchasing a car they will be able to transport goods easily and to take the harvested nuts for selling in the nearby villages. This will increase the income of the family. The increased income will be used for the renovation of their house. Luba awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a car.

loans.name: Mariana Del Carmen

texts.es:
En Achuapa una bella y encantadora ciudad donde se dedica a la agricultura, el comercio y la ganadería, además de poseer estos lindos rubros también se dedica a las culturas Nicaragüenses, está ubicada en el departamento de León, es aquí donde habita Maríana del Carmen. 

Maríana Del Carmen se llama la mujer de 48 años de edad, cuyo marido es agricultor y apenas cubre el sustento diario, con el salario que ella gana como profesora, cubre los gastos de estudios de sus dos hijos.

 Mariana del Carmen  necesita un financiamiento de Kiva y Ceprodel para pagarlo a un plazo de 12 meses para la compra de Sementó, Arena y Ladrillo, para la mejora de su vivienda, no se le han podido cumplir sus deseos de vivir en un mejor techo, ella comenta que estos deseos solo se le pueden hacer realidad con un crédito que le financie Ceprodel y Kiva. 
. 

De momento solo cuenta con su buena salud, su amor al trabajo y su eterno amor a sus hijos donde sueña con verlos vivir en mejores condiciones, todo esto solo se lo puede cumplir a través del crédito que le financie Kiva y Ceprodel.

"Agradezco a Dios como primera instancia por haberle dado una vida saludable y por haber encontrado a Ceprodel y Kiva, para que estos le sigan dando su mano amigable y poder desarrollar en sus actividades"
texts.en:
The beautiful, enchanting city of Acuapa is known for its agriculture, commerce and livestock-farming, as well as its Nicaraguan cultures.  It is in the department of León, where Mariana del Carmen lives.

Mariana del Carmen, 48, is married and has two children.  Her husband is a farmer and barely able to cover daily household expenses.  She works as a teacher and helps cover the children's education costs.

Mariana del Carmen is in need of a loan from Kiva and Ceprodel which she will pay back over a 12-month period.  She plans to buy cement, sand, and bricks to improve the roof of her house.  She claims the only way she can do this is with financing from Ceprodel and Kiva.

She is in good health, loves her work and adores her children, who she wants to grow up in better conditions.  She can only do this through a loan from Kiva and Ceprodel.

"I thank God for having given me good health and for having sent me to Ceprodel and Kiva; hopefully they continue to give me a helping hand so I can carry out my activities."

loans.use: To buy cement, sand and bricks.

loans.name: Tenneh

texts.en:
Tenneh, 26, lives at Airport. She is single with a child that is two years old. She stopped her education in the 10 grade. 

She received the initial capital from her father to start this business. She has been selling plates, glasses, spoons and cups for the past six years. She is proud of her business because with the profit generated from the business she can repay her loan, and attend to the needs of her child. 

She has requested a loan to purchase more plates, spoons, glasses for the business, and hopes to build a decent house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more plates, spoons and glasses for the business.

loans.name: Diana Caridad

texts.es:
La joven Diana de 32 años de edad es madre soltera, tiene una hija de 07 años de edad y se dedica desde hace 13 años al negocio de venta de ropa y calzado para todas las edades.
La Joven Diana tiene su negocio ubicado en su casa de habitación en la comunidad de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras. 
Diana esta solicitando el préstamo para compra de pantalones, blusas, camisetas, shorts, faldas, pijamas, ropa juvenil y para niños. Ya que en la temporada  navideña  se le vende bastante este tipo de prendas de vestir.
Diana con el apoyo de este préstamo para su negocio pretende obtener  ingresos y poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
Diana es una joven emprendedora que a podido manejar el negocio que su padre le heredo, con la ayuda de su madre a podido salir adelante y su deseo es que las ventas sean mejores para este fin de año.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Octubre del 2012.
texts.en:
Young Diana is 32 years old. She is a single mother. She has a daughter who is 7 years old and she has been dedicated for 13 years to a business selling clothing and shoes for all ages.

Diana has her business located in her house in the community of San Lorenzo in the south of Honduras. Diana is requesting the loan to purchase pants, blouses, T-shirts, shorts, skirts, pyjamas, and clothing for children and teens since in the holiday season she sells quite a lot of garments.

Diana, with the support of this loan for her business, seeks to obtain income and be able to improve her quality of life. Diana is a young entrepreneur who has been able to manage the business that she inherited from her father. With the help of her mother she has gotten ahead and her wish is that sales improve for the end of the year.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - October 2012.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, T-shirts, shorts, skirts, pyjamas, and clothes for children and teens for her shop.

loans.name: María Elsa

texts.es:
En el Municipio de Santa Rosa del Peñón una preciosa ciudad dedicada en diferentes actividades ubicada en el departamento de León, la joven María Elsa es conocida como una persona responsable, honesta y dedicada a trabajo.
María Elsa necesita un financiamiento de Kiva y Ceprodel para pagarlo a un plazo de 12 meses para la compra de Sementó, Arena y Ladrillo, para la mejora de su vivienda ya que ella ha sido afectada por fuertes lluvias que le han ocasionado mucho daño.

Es madre soltera con dos hijos bajo su cargo donde trabaja en un centro de salud, con lo poco que ella gana desea mejorar su vivienda y no seguir enfrentando esos problemas que le han ocasionado daño a su familia, pero esto solo se le puede cumplir a través que kiva y ceprodel ponga la mano amigable en su persona. 

De momento solo cuenta con su buena salud, su capacidad de trabajo, su pequeña vivienda que la ha ido construyendo con muchas dificultades, pero que ha sido afectada donde quiere mejorarla.

 "Agradezco a Dios como primer instancia por haberme encontrado con Ceprodel y Kiva, para que estos me sigan dando más ayuda y condiciones de trabajo a las personas"
texts.en:
María Elsa lives in the municipality of Santa Rosa del Peñón, a beautiful city known for lots of different activities, and it is located in the department of León. 

María Elsa is known as a responsible, honest and hard-working woman.  She is seeking a loan from Kiva and Ceprodel, which she will pay back in 12 months, in order to purchase cement, sand, and bricks so that she can improve her home.  Her home has suffered from the strong rain storms that have caused a lot of damage in the region.

She is a single mother of two children that depend on her.  She works in a health center and with the little money that she earns she hopes to make home improvements so that she can stop facing challenges that cause harm to her family.  This can only happen if Kiva and Ceprodel give her a helping hand.

She currently is in good health and has the capacity to work.  Her small home was constructed poorly and has lots of problems, but she wants to make it better.

"Thanks to God I have found Ceprodel and Kiva, because they are providing me with help and providing possibilities for other people to work."

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and bricks.

loans.name: Stephany

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Stephany con su negocio de Fabricación de Bloques. Ella invirtió su anterior  crédito de Kiva en la compró materias primas e insumos y moldes para fabricar persianas; con ese crédito, ha avanzado en su negocio. Logró incrementar sus compras y así su producción,  generando mayores ingresos y mayores ventas. Ahora se han incrementado las ventas y sus utilidades,  aumentando su nivel de vida.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva,  para  comprar moldes de diferentes estilos, hará mejoras locativas y comprará mucho mas materias primas. Stephany quiere decir el siguiente mensaje a sus financiadores: ''Gracias por la oportunidad brindada, así mejoré la sostenibilidad económica en el hogar''
texts.en:
Thank you for supporting Stephany with her brick-making business.  She invested the previous Kiva loan in the purchase of raw materials and supplies, and also molds used to make window coverings.  With this credit, she improved her business.  She succeeded in increasing her purchases and thus her production, generating more income and better sales.  Now her sales have increased she has improved her standard of living.  

Stephany is now applying for a new loan from Kiva so that she can buy molds of different styles, to make repairs, and to buy more raw materials.  Stephany wants to deliver the following message to all the people that funded her loan: "Thank you for the amazing opportunity, and I have improved the financial situation of my household."

loans.use: to buy different styles of molds, to make repairs, and to buy more raw materials.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is 39, and resides with her husband and four children in Airport; her education ended in the 7th grade.  Her children are between the ages of 3 and 19.  She would like to give the best education to her children, but lacks the financial support.  

She sells palm oil at the community market. Her husband is a driver, and he gave her the initial capital to start her business.  She has a good location, and makes a profit.   

She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil to increase her sales.  Her plan is to build house in the future

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil to increase her sales.

loans.name: Dragon De Oro Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “DRAGON DE ORO”  iniciará el vigésimo segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Hilda es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de ropa interior, costura de gorras, producción de chamarras, venta de linaza, venta de ropa, costura de sombreros, venta de comida

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Hilda es integrante, ella indica que hace cinco meses que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de nuestra institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de ropa a medio uso; cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió de su unas amigas hace años, menciona que la llevaron a la ciudad de Oruro a realizar la compra y la orientaron en la forma de adquisición de este producto y al llegar a la paz ella busco un espacio de comercio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ropa a medio uso) que adquirirá de las las personas que venden por mayor y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The "Golden Dragon" group will begin their twenty second loan with Pro Mujer, as part of Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación. It is made up of ten members and is directed by a board where Hilda is the treasurer. The businesses that the members of the community association manager are varied. Among them we have selling underwear, sewing hats, making jackets, selling linseed, selling clothing, making hats and selling food.

The loan that they are taking will benefit small businesses where Hilda is a member. She indicates that five months ago she joined Pro Mujer, joining on a friend's invitation who is a member of our institution. Currently, she has a business selling used clothing. She tells us that she learned this business from some friends years ago. She mentions that they took her to the city of Oruro to make purchases and oriented her in the way to acquire this product and find peace with a space for commerce.

The loan that now will be taken is to expand capital (buy used clothing) that she will acquire from the people who sell at wholesale and later will be sold in her stall. This type of work allows here to generate resources to support her household with whatever possible. She lives in free union and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she responds that she likes the health area.

loans.use: to purchase used clothing.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: Antonio tiene  37  años de edad, esta casado y vive con la esposa y tres hijos actualmente. El con el crédito pretende comprar papa para siembra, y contratar mano de obra que le colaboren. El piensa dar inicio a un proyecto que previamente había pensado, y con este poder generar ganancias para contribuir con su familia, el no cuenta con el capital necesario para dicha compra, ni dichos contratos, ya que es de bajos recursos y no tiene como adquirir el dinero necesario para esto, por lo que el solicito un crédito, y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Antonio is 37 years old, he is married and he lives with his wife and their three children.  With this loan he plans to buy potato seeds and to hire a worker to help him plant potatoes.  He wants to start this project, which he had previously thought about, because he will be able to generate income so that he can contribute to his household expenses.  

He doesn't have the capital necessary to make purchases of supplies, nor to hire anyone, because he is a low-income worker. This is why he is seeking a loan.  It is his first loan from Fudecosur.  He has not had other loans before from the state banks, but Fudecosur has given him his first loan with good terms and a low interest rate.

loans.use: to grow potatoes.

location.town: Bello Oriente, Agua Buena, Coto Brus

loans.name: Ulziitegsh

texts.en:
Mrs.Ulziitegsh is 24 years old and lives with her husband in a Ger in Uvs province, Mongolia. Her husband, Naranhuu, age 24, is a farmer. 

Mrs.Ulziitegsh used to work in a construction company for years. Recently, she helps her husband grow organic vegetables in their garden. It is a profitable business, but it is seasonal. She is planning to increase their income by lengthening the vegetable growing season, as well as the volume of their organic vegetable production. So she is planning to built a storage pit and a greenhouse. 

She is asking for 2,500,000MNT to purchase construction materials to built a storage pit and a greenhouse to increase their income. She and her husband are hardworking, kind, and calm people.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to built a storage pit and greenhouse to increase their income from organic farming.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a widow with 3 children; none of her children are in school.  She takes care of five grandchildren. 

She has a business of selling charcoal and has been in this business for 10 years. She has a loan for 800,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal.  

She generates additional income through selling piped water and rental houses. She sells on a retail basis to all kinds of people, from home 7 days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. 

She is aspiring to become a wholesaler, and also to build more rental rooms. 

She resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses are school fees for the grandchildren, and paying utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es:
Haydee, de 29 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su esposo Adamo y sus 2 hijos: Moisés y Diana a los que cuida en la casa que heredó de sus padres desde hace 11 años. Ya tiene 3 años de experiencia en la venta de productos de primera necesidad en un espacio que acondicionó en su casa, ahí todas las mañanas atiende a sus comensales quienes llegan a comprar los alimentos de manera permanente, solo se ausenta 2 horas durante el día para vender golosina en la escuela de su localidad, donde lleva 2 años vendiendo comida para los niños y profesores que llegan a consumir los ricos platos de Haydee. Ahora dese seguir mejorando su negocio para poder obtener mejores ganancias y mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio, ya que es muy pequeño para sus clientes. Este es el crédito número 3 con MFP, donde se siente desarrollada, ya que obtiene la ayuda económica para progresar en su negocio. Por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
Haydee, invertirá el dinero en la compra de productos de primera necesidad para su tienda de comestibles, como sacos de arroz y azúcar además de panteones en cantidad para la temporada de navidad.
texts.en:
Haydee, 29, is a hard working woman. She is in the company of her husband, Adamo, and their two children: Moises and Diana who she cares for in the house that she inherited from her parents 11 years ago. She already has three years experience selling basic necessity products in a space that she fixed in her house. There, every morning, she attends to her diners who arrive to buy food permanently. She is absent only for two hours during the day to sell candy at the school in her area where she has for two years been selling food for children and teachers who come to consume Haydee's delicious dishes. Now she wishes to keep improving her business to be able to obtain better earnings and improve the infrastructure of her business since it is very small for her customers. This is her third loan with MFP where she feels developed since she obtains economic help to progress with her business. For this she promises to be punctual with the repayments.

Haydee will invest the money in the purchase of basic necessity products for her food shop, such as bags of rice and sugar as well as items for Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice and sugar as well as items for Christmas season.

loans.name: Danixa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “EMPRENDEDORES DE SAN CRISTOBAL”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Danixa; La socia continua con su negocio de venta de materiales de construccion como piedras,cemento,arena entre otros,la socia lleva años en este su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de cemento para su negocio.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota en el tiempo estipulado.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the community bank "EMPRENDEDORES DE SAN CRISTOBAL.”  This bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

Danixa's business is to sell construction materials such as stones, cement, sand, and other materials like these.  She has worked many years in this business and it has gone well thanks to the hard work that she puts in every day.  She is a responsible and hard-working person and she believes that these traits help her family get ahead.

She is seeking a loan so that she can buy cement for her business.  She is happy to receive this loan and promises to comply with the stipulated payment terms.

loans.use: to buy cement for her business.

loans.name: Duteraninkunga C12057 Group

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 35 years old and is married with three children between the ages of 5 and 12 years old. Emmanuel's business is selling rice. He is the leader of a group called "DUTERANINKUNGA C12057" in the local language. In the photo, Emmanuel is the one who is raising his hand. He has one year of experience, and he works from 6.30 a.m. to 1 p.m. every day except on weekends. 

Emmanuel has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his rice business by cultivating a large quantity of rice for resale. If successful, he will be able to save money for his future, in order to get more food for his family and to renovate his house.

loans.use: To expand his rice business by cultivating a large quantity of rice for resale.
